questions.question: A company plans to use an Amazon Snowball Edge device to transfer files to the AWS Cloud. Which activities related to a Snowball Edge device are available to the company at no cost?
options: Use of the Snowball Edge appliance for a 10-day period
The transfer of data out of Amazon S3 and to the Snowball Edge appliance
The transfer of data from the Snowball Edge appliance into Amazon S3
Daily use of the Snowball Edge appliance after 10 days
questions.answer: Use of the Snowball Edge appliance for a 10-day period
questions.verified_answer: Use of the Snowball Edge appliance for a 10-day period
questions.explanation: The company can use the Snowball Edge device for a 10-day period at no additional cost, allowing them to transfer their data without incurring extra fees for the initial period. After the 10-day period, the company will be charged for each additional day they use the device.

questions.question: A company has deployed applications on Amazon EC2 instances. The company needs to assess application vulnerabilities and must identify infrastructure deployments that do not meet best practices. Which AWS service can the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon Inspector is an AWS service that assesses application vulnerabilities and identifies infrastructure deployments that do not meet best practices. It provides a comprehensive view of security and compliance issues, making it the correct choice for the company's requirements.

questions.question: A company has a centralized group of users with large file storage requirements that have exceeded the space available on premises. The company wants to extend its file storage capabilities for this group while retaining the performance benefit of sharing content locally. What is the MOST operationally efficient AWS solution for this scenario?
options: Create an Amazon S3 bucket for each user. Mount each bucket by using an S3 file system mounting utility.
Configure and deploy an AWS Storage Gateway file gateway. Connect each user's workstation to the file gateway.
Move each user's working environment to Amazon WorkSpaces. Set up an Amazon WorkDocs account for each user.
Deploy an Amazon EC2 instance and attach an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) Provisioned IOPS volume. Share the EBS volume directly with the users.
questions.answer: Configure and deploy an AWS Storage Gateway file gateway. Connect each user's workstation to the file gateway.
questions.explanation: This solution allows the company to extend its file storage capabilities while retaining local performance benefits by caching frequently accessed files on premises. The AWS Storage Gateway file gateway integrates with Amazon S3, providing a cost-effective and operationally efficient solution for large file storage requirements.
questions.verified_answer: Configure and deploy an AWS Storage Gateway file gateway. Connect each user's workstation to the file gateway.

questions.question: According to security best practices, how should an Amazon EC2 instance be given access to an Amazon S3 bucket?
options: Hard code an IAM user's secret key and access key directly in the application, and upload the file.
Store the IAM user's secret key and access key in a text file on the EC2 instance, read the keys, then upload the file.
Have the EC2 instance assume a role to obtain the privileges to upload the file.
Modify the S3 bucket policy so that any service can upload to it at any time.
questions.answer: Have the EC2 instance assume a role to obtain the privileges to upload the file.
questions.explanation: This is the most secure option as it uses AWS IAM roles to delegate permissions to the EC2 instance without exposing sensitive credentials. This approach also allows for fine-grained access control and auditing.
questions.verified_answer: Have the EC2 instance assume a role to obtain the privileges to upload the file.

questions.question: Which option is a customer responsibility when using Amazon DynamoDB under the AWS Shared Responsibility Model?
options: Encryption of data at rest in DynamoDB
questions.explanation: Under the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, customers are responsible for managing access to their DynamoDB tables, including user authentication and authorization. This includes controlling who has access to the tables and what actions they can perform on them.

questions.question: Which option is a perspective that includes foundational capabilities of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF)?
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) is a business-focused approach to cloud adoption, and governance is one of its foundational capabilities. Governance encompasses the policies, procedures, and standards that ensure the secure and efficient use of cloud resources.

questions.question: A company is running and managing its own Docker environment on Amazon EC2 instances. The company wants an alternative to help manage cluster size, scheduling, and environment maintenance. Which AWS service meets these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers that can manage cluster size, scheduling, and environment maintenance, making it a suitable alternative for the company's Docker environment. It allows users to run containers without worrying about the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question: A company wants to run a NoSQL database on Amazon EC2 instances. Which task is the responsibility of AWS in this scenario?
options: Update the guest operating system of the EC2 instances
Maintain high availability at the database layer
Patch the physical infrastructure that hosts the EC2 instances
questions.answer: Patch the physical infrastructure that hosts the EC2 instances
questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for maintaining high availability at the database layer for services like Amazon DynamoDB, but not for NoSQL databases running on EC2 instances. The company is responsible for patching the physical infrastructure that hosts the EC2 instances.
questions.verified_answer: Maintain high availability at the database layer

questions.question: Which AWS services or tools can identify rightsizing opportunities for Amazon EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: AWS Compute Optimizer is a service that identifies opportunities to optimize Amazon EC2 instance types and sizes, reducing costs without affecting performance. AWS Cost Explorer is a tool that provides detailed cost and usage analysis, but it does not specifically identify rightsizing opportunities.

questions.question: Which of the following are benefits of using AWS Trusted Advisor?
options: Detecting underutilized resources to save costs
Improving security by proactively monitoring the AWS environment
Implementing enforced tagging across AWS resources
answer: Detecting underutilized resources to save costs
Improving security by proactively monitoring the AWS environment
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides best practices checks for cost optimization, security, performance, and more. It helps detect underutilized resources to save costs and improves security by proactively monitoring the AWS environment.
questions.verified_answer: Detecting underutilized resources to save costs, Improving security by proactively monitoring the AWS environment

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage that users experience when they move on-premises workloads to the AWS Cloud?
options: Elimination of expenses for running and maintaining data centers
Price discounts that are identical to discounts from hardware providers
Distribution of all operational controls to AWS
questions.answer: Elimination of expenses for running and maintaining data centers
questions.explanation: Moving on-premises workloads to the AWS Cloud can help reduce operational expenses by eliminating the need to maintain and run data centers. This is a significant advantage for users as it can lead to cost savings and increased efficiency.
questions.verified_answer: Elimination of expenses for running and maintaining data centers

questions.question: A company wants to manage deployed IT services and govern its infrastructure as code (IaC) templates. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS Service Catalog allows users to manage deployed IT services and govern infrastructure as code (IaC) templates by providing a centralized platform for managing and sharing approved services, including IaC templates. It helps organizations maintain consistency and control over their infrastructure and services.

questions.question: Which AWS service or tool helps users visualize, understand, and manage spending and usage over time?
questions.explanation: AWS Cost Explorer is a service that helps users visualize, understand, and manage spending and usage over time. It provides detailed cost and usage reports, allowing users to track their expenses and make informed decisions about their AWS resources.

questions.question: A company is using a central data platform to manage multiple types of data for its customers. The company wants to use AWS services to discover, transform, and visualize the data. Which combination of AWS services should the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Glue is used for discovering and transforming data, while Amazon QuickSight is used for visualizing the data. This combination meets the company's requirements for data discovery, transformation, and visualization.

questions.question: A global company wants to migrate its third-party applications to the AWS Cloud. The company wants help from a global team of experts to complete the migration faster and more reliably in accordance with AWS internal best practices. Which AWS service or resource will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Professional Services provides expert guidance and hands-on support to help customers migrate their applications to the AWS Cloud, following AWS best practices. This service is ideal for complex migrations that require a global team of experts.

questions.question: An e-learning platform needs to run an application for 2 months each year. The application will be deployed on Amazon EC2 instances. Any application downtime during those 2 months must be avoided. Which EC2 purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide a discounted hourly rate for a one- or three-year commitment, making them the most cost-effective option for a specific usage pattern like this. On-Demand Instances, while flexible, do not offer the same level of cost savings as Reserved Instances.

questions.question: A developer wants to deploy an application quickly on AWS without manually creating the required resources. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk is a service that allows developers to deploy web applications and services without worrying about the underlying infrastructure. It supports a variety of platforms, including .NET, Node.js, Python, and Ruby, making it a suitable choice for quick deployment.

questions.question: A company is storing sensitive customer data in an Amazon S3 bucket. The company wants to protect the data from accidental deletion or overwriting. Which S3 feature should the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: S3 Versioning allows you to keep multiple versions of an object in the same bucket, preventing accidental deletion or overwriting. This feature is ideal for storing sensitive data where data integrity is crucial.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides the ability to manage infrastructure as code?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation is a service that allows users to manage and provision infrastructure as code, providing a template-driven approach to create and manage AWS resources. This enables infrastructure to be version-controlled, reviewed, and reproducible.

questions.question: An online gaming company needs to choose a purchasing option to run its Amazon EC2 instances for 1 year. The web traffic is consistent, and any increases in traffic are predictable. The EC2 instances must be online and available without any disruption. Which EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide a significant discount compared to On-Demand Instances, making them the most cost-effective option for consistent and predictable workloads. They also ensure that the instances are always available without any disruption.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature allows a user to establish a dedicated network connection between a company’s on-premises data center and the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect is a service that allows users to establish a dedicated network connection between their on-premises data center and the AWS Cloud, providing a more reliable and faster connection compared to the internet. This is particularly useful for applications that require low latency and high bandwidth.

questions.question: Which option is a physical location of the AWS global infrastructure?
questions.explanation: AWS Regions are physical locations where AWS infrastructure is deployed, such as data centers and edge locations. This allows AWS to provide services with low latency and high availability to users worldwide.

questions.question: A company wants to protect its AWS Cloud information, systems, and assets while performing risk assessment and mitigation. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework is supported by these goals?
questions.explanation: The Security pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework focuses on protecting AWS Cloud information, systems, and assets, which aligns with the company's goals. This pillar helps identify and mitigate potential security risks, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data.

questions.question: What is the purpose of having an internet gateway within a VPC?
options: To create a VPN connection to the VPC
To allow communication between the VPC and the internet
To impose bandwidth constraints on internet traffic
To load balance traffic from the internet across Amazon EC2 instances
questions.answer: To allow communication between the VPC and the internet
questions.explanation: An internet gateway is used to enable instances within a VPC to communicate with the internet. It allows incoming and outgoing traffic to and from the VPC.
questions.verified_answer: To allow communication between the VPC and the internet

questions.question: A company is running a monolithic on-premises application that does not scale and is difficult to maintain. The company has a plan to migrate the application to AWS and divide the application into microservices. Which best practice of the AWS Well-Architected Framework is the company following with this plan?
options: Integrate functional testing as part of AWS deployment.
Deploy the application to multiple locations.
questions.explanation: The company is following the best practice of implementing loosely coupled dependencies by dividing the monolithic application into microservices, which allows for greater flexibility and scalability. This approach aligns with the AWS Well-Architected Framework's principle of designing for scalability and reliability.

questions.question: A company has an AWS account. The company wants to audit its password and access key rotation details for compliance purposes. Which AWS service or tool will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: The IAM credential report is a daily CSV report that contains information about the IAM users, roles, and groups in your AWS account, including their access keys and password rotation details. This report helps with compliance and auditing purposes.

questions.question: A company wants to receive a notification when a specific AWS cost threshold is reached. Which AWS services or tools can the company use to meet this requirement? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows the company to set a specific cost threshold and receive notifications when it is reached. Amazon CloudWatch can also be used to set alarms based on AWS cost metrics, enabling the company to receive notifications when the threshold is reached.

questions.question: Which AWS service or resource provides answers to the most frequently asked security-related questions that AWS receives from its users?
questions.explanation: The AWS Knowledge Center is a resource that provides answers to frequently asked security-related questions, as well as other general questions about AWS services and features. It is a valuable resource for users to find information and resolve issues quickly.

questions.question: Which tasks are customer responsibilities, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)
options: Configure the AWS provided security group firewall.
Classify company assets in the AWS Cloud.
Determine which Availability Zones to use for Amazon S3 buckets.
Select Amazon EC2 instances to run AWS Lambda on.
answer: Configure the AWS provided security group firewall.
Classify company assets in the AWS Cloud.
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for configuring their own security settings, including security groups. They are also responsible for classifying and managing their own company assets in the cloud.
questions.verified_answer: Configure the AWS provided security group firewall. Classify company assets in the AWS Cloud.

questions.question: Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The AWS Well-Architected Framework has five pillars: Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, and Cost Optimization. Operational Excellence is one of the pillars, focusing on running and managing systems for the long term.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature is used to send both text and email messages from distributed applications?
questions.explanation: Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) is used to send messages to distributed applications, including both text and email messages. It supports multiple protocols and endpoints, making it a versatile choice for notification needs.

questions.question: A user needs programmatic access to AWS resources through the AWS CLI or the AWS API. Which option will provide the user with the appropriate access?
options: AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) keys
questions.explanation: Access keys provide programmatic access to AWS resources through the AWS CLI or the AWS API. They consist of an access key ID and a secret access key, which are used to authenticate and authorize access to AWS services.

questions.question: A company runs thousands of simultaneous simulations using AWS Batch. Each simulation is stateless, is fault tolerant, and runs for up to 3 hours. Which pricing model enables the company to optimize costs and meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances allow the company to optimize costs by bidding on unused EC2 capacity, which is suitable for stateless, fault-tolerant simulations. This pricing model also meets the requirement of running for up to 3 hours, as Spot Instances can be interrupted after the bid expires.

questions.question: What does the concept of agility mean in AWS Cloud computing? (Choose two.)
options: The speed at which AWS resources are implemented
The speed at which AWS creates new AWS Regions
The low cost of entry into cloud computing
answer: The speed at which AWS resources are implemented
questions.explanation: Agility in AWS Cloud computing refers to the ability to quickly implement resources and experiment with new ideas, allowing for faster development and deployment of applications. This enables businesses to be more responsive to changing market conditions and customer needs.
verified_answer: The speed at which AWS resources are implemented

questions.question: A company needs to block SQL injection attacks. Which AWS service or feature can meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) is a web application firewall that helps protect web applications from common web exploits and SQL injection attacks. It can be used to filter traffic and block malicious requests before they reach the application.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature identifies whether an Amazon S3 bucket or an IAM role has been shared with an external entity?
questions.explanation: AWS IAM Access Analyzer is a service that helps you identify whether an Amazon S3 bucket or an IAM role has been shared with an external entity, providing visibility into cross-account access and resource sharing.

questions.question: A cloud practitioner needs to obtain AWS compliance reports before migrating an environment to the AWS Cloud. How can these reports be generated?
options: Download the reports from AWS Artifact.
Open a case with AWS Support.
Generate the reports with Amazon Macie.
questions.answer: Download the reports from AWS Artifact.
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to compliance reports and artifacts for AWS services, allowing cloud practitioners to easily obtain the necessary information before migrating their environment to the AWS Cloud.
questions.verified_answer: Download the reports from AWS Artifact.

questions.question: An ecommerce company has migrated its IT infrastructure from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud. Which cost is the company's direct responsibility?
options: Cost of the hardware infrastructure on AWS
Cost of power for the AWS servers
Cost of physical security for the AWS data center
questions.explanation: The company is responsible for the cost of application software licenses as they are the ones purchasing and managing the licenses. The other options are not directly responsible to the company as they are managed by AWS.

questions.question: A company is setting up AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) on an AWS account. Which recommendation complies with IAM security best practices?
options: Use the account root user access keys for administrative tasks.
Grant broad permissions so that all company employees can access the resources they need.
Turn on multi-factor authentication (MFA) for added security during the login process.
Avoid rotating credentials to prevent issues in production applications.
questions.answer: Turn on multi-factor authentication (MFA) for added security during the login process.
questions.explanation: This option complies with IAM security best practices as MFA adds an extra layer of security to the login process, making it more difficult for unauthorized users to access the account. This is a recommended practice to prevent unauthorized access to AWS resources.
questions.verified_answer: Turn on multi-factor authentication (MFA) for added security during the login process.

questions.question: Elasticity in the AWS Cloud refers to which of the following? (Choose two.)
options: How quickly an Amazon EC2 instance can be restarted
The ability to rightsize resources as demand shifts
The maximum amount of RAM an Amazon EC2 instance can use
How easily resources can be procured when they are needed
answer: The ability to rightsize resources as demand shifts
How easily resources can be procured when they are needed
questions.explanation: Elasticity in the AWS Cloud refers to the ability to quickly scale resources up or down in response to changing demands. This includes the ability to rightsize resources as demand shifts and procure resources easily when needed.
questions.verified_answer: The ability to rightsize resources as demand shifts, How easily resources can be procured when they are needed

questions.question: Which service enables customers to audit API calls in their AWS accounts?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail is a service that enables customers to audit API calls in their AWS accounts, providing a record of all API calls made within their AWS environment. This allows for better security, compliance, and troubleshooting.

questions.question: What is a customer responsibility when using AWS Lambda according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: Managing the code within the Lambda function
Confirming that the hardware is working in the data center
Shutting down Lambda functions when they are no longer in use
questions.answer: Managing the code within the Lambda function
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for managing the code and data within their AWS services, including AWS Lambda. This includes writing, testing, and maintaining the code for their Lambda functions.
questions.verified_answer: Managing the code within the Lambda function

questions.question: A company has 5 TB of data stored in Amazon S3. The company plans to occasionally run queries on the data for analysis. Which AWS service should the company use to run these queries in the MOST cost-effective manner?
questions.explanation: Amazon Athena is a serverless query service that allows users to run SQL queries on data in Amazon S3 without the need to set up or manage any infrastructure. This makes it a cost-effective option for occasional queries, as users only pay for the queries they run.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used at no additional cost?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations is a service that enables you to manage multiple AWS accounts as a single entity, and it can be used at no additional cost. This is because AWS Organizations is a free service, with no extra fees beyond what you pay for the AWS services you use.

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) capability belongs to the people perspective?
questions.explanation: The people perspective in the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) focuses on the skills, culture, and organization of an enterprise. Cloud fluency is a capability that belongs to this perspective, as it involves developing the skills and knowledge needed to effectively use cloud technologies.

questions.question: A company wants to make an upfront commitment for continued use of its production Amazon EC2 instances in exchange for a reduced overall cost. Which pricing options meet these requirements with the LOWEST cost? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances and Savings Plans both offer upfront commitments in exchange for reduced costs. They are the most cost-effective options for making an upfront commitment for continued use of production Amazon EC2 instances.

questions.question: A company wants to migrate its on-premises relational databases to the AWS Cloud. The company wants to use infrastructure as close to its current geographical location as possible. Which AWS service or resource should the company use to select its Amazon RDS deployment area?
questions.explanation: The company should use AWS Regions to select its Amazon RDS deployment area, as it allows them to choose a region that is closest to their current geographical location. This ensures low latency and high performance for their database operations.

questions.question: A company is exploring the use of the AWS Cloud, and needs to create a cost estimate for a project before the infrastructure is provisioned. Which AWS service or feature can be used to estimate costs before deployment?
questions.explanation: The AWS Pricing Calculator allows users to estimate costs before deployment by providing a detailed breakdown of costs based on the chosen services, instance types, and usage. This enables companies to make informed decisions about their infrastructure and budget.

questions.question: A company is building an application that needs to deliver images and videos globally with minimal latency. Which approach can the company use to accomplish this in a cost effective manner?
options: Deliver the content through Amazon CloudFront.
Store the content on Amazon S3 and enable S3 cross-region replication.
Implement a VPN across multiple AWS Regions.
Deliver the content through AWS PrivateLink.
questions.answer: Deliver the content through Amazon CloudFront.
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) that can cache and distribute content globally, reducing latency and improving performance. It is a cost-effective solution for delivering images and videos to a global audience.
questions.verified_answer: Deliver the content through Amazon CloudFront.

questions.question: Which option is a benefit of the economies of scale based on the advantages of cloud computing?
options: The ability to trade variable expense for fixed expense
Lower variable costs over fixed costs
Increased operational costs across data centers
questions.answer: Lower variable costs over fixed costs
questions.explanation: Economies of scale in cloud computing allow businesses to reduce their costs by spreading fixed expenses across a large user base, resulting in lower variable costs compared to traditional on-premises infrastructure.
questions.verified_answer: Lower variable costs over fixed costs

questions.question: Which of the following is a software development framework that a company can use to define cloud resources as code and provision the resources through AWS CloudFormation?
questions.explanation: AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK) is an open-source software development framework that allows developers to define cloud resources as code and provision them through AWS CloudFormation. It provides a set of languages and tools to define cloud infrastructure in a declarative and programmatic way.

questions.question: A company is developing an application that uses multiple AWS services. The application needs to use temporary, limited-privilege credentials for authentication with other AWS APIs. Which AWS service or feature should the company use to meet these authentication requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS STS provides temporary, limited-privilege credentials for authentication with other AWS APIs, meeting the application's requirements. This service is specifically designed for short-term, temporary access to AWS resources.

questions.question: Which AWS service is a cloud security posture management (CSPM) service that aggregates alerts from various AWS services and partner products in a standardized format?
questions.explanation: AWS Security Hub is a cloud security posture management (CSPM) service that aggregates alerts from various AWS services and partner products in a standardized format, providing a comprehensive view of an organization's security posture.

questions.question: Which AWS service is always provided at no charge?
questions.explanation: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) is a free service that enables you to manage access to your AWS resources. It is always provided at no charge, regardless of the number of users or resources you manage.

questions.question: To reduce costs, a company is planning to migrate a NoSQL database to AWS. Which AWS service is fully managed and can automatically scale throughput capacity to meet database workload demands?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that automatically scales throughput capacity to meet database workload demands, making it an ideal choice for cost reduction. It provides a highly available and durable database that can handle large amounts of data and traffic.

questions.question: A company is using Amazon DynamoDB. Which task is the company's responsibility, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for managing database access permissions, including user authentication and authorization. This includes controlling access to the database and ensuring that only authorized users can read or write data.

questions.question: A company has a test AWS environment. A company is planning on testing an application within AWS. The application testing can be interrupted and does not need to run continuously. Which Amazon EC2 purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are the most cost-effective option for non-continuous workloads, as they allow for temporary access to EC2 instances at a discounted rate. This option is ideal for applications that can be interrupted and do not require continuous running.

questions.question: Which AWS service gives users the ability to discover and protect sensitive data that is stored in Amazon S3 buckets?
questions.explanation: Amazon Macie is a service that uses machine learning to discover and protect sensitive data stored in Amazon S3 buckets. It helps identify and classify sensitive data, such as personal identifiable information (PII), and provides recommendations for remediation.

questions.question: Which of the following services can be used to block network traffic to an instance? (Choose two.)
options: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) flow logs
questions.explanation: Security groups and Network ACLs are used to control incoming and outgoing traffic to and from instances in a VPC. They can be used to block network traffic to an instance by denying access to specific ports or IP addresses.

questions.question: Which AWS service can identify when an Amazon EC2 instance was terminated?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail is a service that captures API calls made within an AWS account, including those made to terminate an EC2 instance. This allows for auditing and tracking of instance termination events.

questions.question: Which of the following is a fully managed MySQL-compatible database?
questions.explanation: Amazon Aurora is a fully managed relational database service that supports MySQL-compatible databases, allowing for seamless migration and compatibility with MySQL applications. It provides high performance, durability, and scalability, making it an ideal choice for MySQL workloads.

questions.question: Which AWS service supports a hybrid architecture that gives users the ability to extend AWS infrastructure, AWS services, APIs, and tools to data centers, co-location environments, or on-premises facilities?
questions.explanation: AWS Outposts is a service that allows users to extend AWS infrastructure, services, APIs, and tools to data centers, co-location environments, or on-premises facilities, enabling a hybrid architecture. This allows users to run AWS services on-premises, providing a consistent experience with AWS public cloud services.

questions.question: Which AWS service can run a managed PostgreSQL database that provides online transaction processing (OLTP)?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS provides a managed relational database service that supports various database engines, including PostgreSQL. It is well-suited for online transaction processing (OLTP) workloads due to its high performance, reliability, and scalability features.

questions.question: A company wants to provide managed Windows virtual desktops and applications to its remote employees over secure network connections. Which AWS services can the company use to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon AppStream 2.0 provides managed Windows virtual desktops and applications over secure network connections, while Amazon WorkSpaces provides managed Windows desktops in the cloud. Both services meet the company's requirements.

questions.question: A company wants to monitor for misconfigured security groups that are allowing unrestricted access to specific ports. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Amazon GuardDuty is an AWS service that continuously monitors and analyzes network and account activity to identify potential security threats. It can detect misconfigured security groups and alert the user to potential security risks.

questions.question: Which AWS service is a key-value database that provides sub-millisecond latency on a large scale?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fast, fully managed NoSQL database service that provides sub-millisecond latency on a large scale. It is designed to handle high traffic and provides a key-value database structure.

questions.question: A company is deploying a machine learning (ML) research project that will require a lot of compute power over several months. The ML processing jobs do not need to run at specific times. Which Amazon EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements at the lowest cost?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances provide the lowest cost option for EC2 instances, as they allow AWS to allocate unused capacity at a discounted rate. Since the ML processing jobs do not need to run at specific times, Spot Instances are a suitable choice as they can be interrupted or terminated if the instance is needed for a higher-priority task.

questions.question: Which AWS services or features provide disaster recovery solutions for Amazon EC2 instances? (Choose two.)
options: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) snapshots
answer: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) snapshots
questions.explanation: EC2 Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) provide a way to create and manage snapshots of EC2 instances, which can be used for disaster recovery. Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) snapshots allow for the creation of point-in-time copies of EBS volumes, enabling recovery in case of data loss or corruption.
questions.verified_answer: EC2 Amazon Machine Images (AMIs), Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) snapshots

questions.question: Which AWS service provides command line access to AWS tools and resources directly from a web browser?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudShell provides a browser-based command line interface to AWS tools and resources, allowing users to run commands and access resources directly from a web browser. This service is designed for users who need to access AWS resources without having to install and configure a local command line interface.

questions.question: A network engineer needs to build a hybrid cloud architecture connecting on-premises networks to the AWS Cloud using AWS Direct Connect. The company has a few VPCs in a single AWS Region and expects to increase the number of VPCs to hundreds over time. Which AWS service or feature should the engineer use to simplify and scale this connectivity as the VPCs increase in number?
questions.explanation: AWS Transit Gateway is a network service that makes it easier to connect multiple VPCs to each other, as well as to on-premises networks, making it a suitable choice for this scenario. It simplifies and scales connectivity as the number of VPCs increases.

questions.question: A company wants to assess its operational readiness. It also wants to identify and mitigate any operational risks ahead of a new product launch. Which AWS Support plan offers guidance and support for this kind of event at no additional charge?
questions.explanation: AWS Enterprise Support provides 24/7 access to the AWS Support API, AWS Trusted Advisor, and AWS Support Engineers who can offer guidance and support for critical issues, including operational readiness and risk mitigation. This support is available at no additional charge for eligible business and enterprise customers.

questions.question: A company wants to establish a schedule for rotating database user credentials. Which AWS service will support this requirement with the LEAST amount of operational overhead?
questions.explanation: AWS Secrets Manager supports rotating database user credentials with minimal operational overhead by automatically rotating secrets and storing them securely. It also integrates with various AWS services and third-party applications.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature can be used to create a private connection between an on-premises workload and an AWS Cloud workload?
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect is a service that enables a dedicated network connection from an on-premises workload to AWS, providing a private and secure connection. This allows for low-latency and high-bandwidth connectivity between on-premises and cloud workloads.

questions.question: Which AWS service is used to provide encryption for Amazon EBS?
questions.explanation: AWS Key Management Service (KMS) is used to provide encryption for Amazon EBS by managing the encryption keys. This allows for secure and centralized key management for EBS volumes.

questions.question: A company wants to manage its AWS Cloud resources through a web interface. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: The AWS Management Console is a web-based interface that allows users to manage and monitor their AWS resources. It provides a user-friendly interface for users to access and manage their AWS resources.

questions.question: Which of the following are advantages of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
options: Trade variable expenses for capital expenses
questions.explanation: The correct answer highlights two key advantages of the AWS Cloud: high economies of scale due to shared resources and the ability to launch globally in minutes, allowing for rapid deployment and scalability.
questions.verified_answer: High economies of scale, Launch globally in minutes

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud benefit is shown by an architecture's ability to withstand failures with minimal downtime?
questions.explanation: High availability refers to the ability of a system to withstand failures with minimal downtime, ensuring that the system remains operational and accessible to users. This is a key benefit of designing architectures with high availability in mind.

questions.question: A developer needs to maintain a development environment infrastructure and a production environment infrastructure in a repeatable fashion. Which AWS service should the developer use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation is a service that allows developers to create and manage infrastructure as code, making it ideal for maintaining development and production environments in a repeatable fashion. It provides a template-based approach to provisioning and managing infrastructure resources.

questions.question: Which task is the customer's responsibility, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: Maintain the security of the AWS Cloud.
Patch the operating system of Amazon RDS instances.
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for configuring firewalls and networks to ensure the security of their resources. This includes setting up network access controls, configuring security groups, and implementing other network security measures.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps deliver highly available applications with fast failover for multi-Region and Multi-AZ architectures?
questions.explanation: AWS Global Accelerator helps deliver highly available applications with fast failover for multi-Region and Multi-AZ architectures by routing traffic to healthy endpoints. It provides low latency and high availability for applications, making it suitable for mission-critical applications.

questions.question: A company has a set of ecommerce applications. The applications need to be able to send messages to each other. Which AWS service meets this requirement?
questions.explanation: Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) is a fully managed message queuing service that enables applications to send and receive messages from a queue. This allows the ecommerce applications to send messages to each other without being directly connected.

questions.question: What are the benefits of consolidated billing for AWS Cloud services? (Choose two.)
options: A minimal additional fee for use
Custom cost and usage budget creation
questions.explanation: Consolidated billing allows for a single bill to be generated for multiple AWS accounts, making it easier to manage costs. Additionally, it provides volume discounts for eligible services, reducing the overall cost of using AWS.

questions.question: A user wants to review all Amazon S3 buckets with ACLs and S3 bucket policies in the S3 console. Which AWS service or resource will meet this requirement?
options: AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On)
questions.explanation: Access Analyzer for S3 helps identify permissions and access to S3 buckets, including bucket policies and ACLs. It provides a detailed view of access to S3 resources, making it suitable for reviewing bucket permissions.

questions.question: What is the best resource for a user to find compliance-related information and reports about AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact is a service that provides on-demand access to compliance reports and artifacts for AWS. It helps users meet compliance requirements by providing easy access to relevant information.

questions.question: Which AWS service enables companies to deploy an application close to end users?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) that enables companies to deploy an application close to end users by caching content at edge locations around the world. This reduces latency and improves the overall user experience.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature improves network performance by sending traffic through the AWS worldwide network infrastructure?
questions.explanation: AWS Global Accelerator improves network performance by routing traffic through the AWS worldwide network infrastructure, reducing latency and improving the overall user experience. It does this by using a global network of edge locations to cache and distribute content, and by providing a static IP address for your application.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides highly durable object storage?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is a highly durable object storage service that stores data as objects within buckets. It provides a highly available and durable storage solution for data archiving, backup, and disaster recovery.

questions.question: Which responsibility belongs to AWS when a company hosts its databases on Amazon EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: When hosting databases on Amazon EC2 instances, the company is responsible for database software patches, while AWS is responsible for operating system patches. This is because the company has control over the database software, but AWS manages the underlying operating system.

questions.question: Which of the following are advantages of moving to the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
options: The ability to turn over the responsibility for all security to AWS.
The ability to use the pay-as-you-go model.
The ability to have full control over the physical infrastructure.
No longer having to guess what capacity will be required.
No longer worrying about users access controls.
answer: The ability to use the pay-as-you-go model.
No longer having to guess what capacity will be required.
questions.explanation: Moving to the AWS Cloud allows businesses to scale up or down as needed, eliminating the need to over-provision or under-provision resources. The pay-as-you-go model also provides cost savings by only paying for what is used.
verified_answer: The ability to use the pay-as-you-go model.
No longer having to guess what capacity will be required.

questions.question: Which AWS service is a hybrid cloud storage service that provides on-premises users access to virtually unlimited cloud storage?
questions.explanation: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid cloud storage service that provides on-premises users access to virtually unlimited cloud storage. It allows users to store data in Amazon S3 and access it from their on-premises environment.

questions.question: A company plans to migrate to AWS and wants to create cost estimates for its AWS use cases. Which AWS service or tool can the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: The AWS Pricing Calculator is a tool that allows users to estimate costs for their AWS use cases by providing a detailed breakdown of costs based on the services used, instance types, and regions. It helps companies plan and budget for their AWS expenses.

questions.question: Which tool should a developer use to integrate AWS service features directly into an application?
questions.explanation: The AWS Software Development Kit (SDK) provides a set of tools and libraries that allow developers to integrate AWS service features directly into their applications. This enables developers to access AWS services programmatically and build custom applications that leverage the capabilities of AWS.

questions.question: Which of the following is a recommended design principle of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
options: Reduce downtime by making infrastructure changes infrequently and in large increments.
Invest the time to configure infrastructure manually.
Learn to improve from operational failures.
Use monolithic application design for centralization.
questions.answer: Learn to improve from operational failures.
questions.explanation: The AWS Well-Architected Framework emphasizes the importance of continuous improvement and learning from operational failures to ensure the reliability and security of cloud-based systems. This principle encourages organizations to analyze and learn from failures to improve their overall architecture and operations.
questions.verified_answer: Learn to improve from operational failures.

questions.question: Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) to grant access only to the resources needed to perform a task is a concept known as:
questions.explanation: Least privilege access is a security best practice that grants users or services only the permissions and access they need to perform their tasks, minimizing the risk of unauthorized access or malicious activity.

questions.question: Which AWS service or tool can be used to set up a firewall to control traffic going into and coming out of an Amazon VPC subnet?
questions.explanation: A Network ACL is a stateless firewall that controls inbound and outbound traffic to and from a subnet in a VPC. It is used to filter traffic based on IP addresses and ports.

questions.question: A company wants to operate a data warehouse to analyze data without managing the data warehouse infrastructure. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift Serverless is a serverless data warehouse service that allows users to analyze data without managing the underlying infrastructure. It automatically scales to handle changing workloads and provides a cost-effective solution for data warehousing needs.

questions.question: How does AWS Cloud computing help businesses reduce costs? (Choose two.)
options: AWS charges the same prices for services in every AWS Region.
AWS enables capacity to be adjusted on demand.
AWS offers discounts for Amazon EC2 instances that remain idle for more than 1 week.
AWS does not charge for data sent from the AWS Cloud to the internet.
AWS eliminates many of the costs of building and maintaining on-premises data centers.
answer: AWS enables capacity to be adjusted on demand.
AWS eliminates many of the costs of building and maintaining on-premises data centers.
questions.explanation: AWS Cloud computing helps businesses reduce costs by allowing them to adjust their capacity on demand, which means they only pay for the resources they use. Additionally, AWS eliminates many of the costs associated with building and maintaining on-premises data centers, such as infrastructure, maintenance, and personnel costs.
verified_answer: AWS enables capacity to be adjusted on demand.
AWS eliminates many of the costs of building and maintaining on-premises data centers.

questions.question: A company wants to grant users in one AWS account access to resources in another AWS account. The users do not currently have permission to access the resources. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: An IAM role allows users to access resources in another AWS account, making it the correct choice. This is achieved by assuming the role, which grants temporary access to the resources in the other account.

questions.question: Which task is the responsibility of AWS when using AWS services?
options: Creation of security group rules for outbound access
Maintenance of physical and environmental controls
Application of Amazon EC2 operating system patches
questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for managing IAM user permissions, as it is a core service provided by AWS. This includes creating, managing, and enforcing access controls for IAM users.

questions.question: A company wants to automate infrastructure deployment by using infrastructure as code (IaC). The company wants to scale production stacks so the stacks can be deployed in multiple AWS Regions. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation is a service that allows users to manage and provision infrastructure as code, making it suitable for automating infrastructure deployment. It also supports cross-region deployment, allowing users to deploy stacks in multiple AWS Regions.

questions.question: Which option is an AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) platform perspective capability?
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) platform perspective includes capabilities such as data architecture, which focuses on designing and implementing data management systems. Data architecture is indeed a key capability within the AWS CAF platform perspective, making the given answer correct.

questions.question: A company is running a workload in the AWS Cloud. Which AWS best practice ensures the MOST cost-effective architecture for the workload?
questions.explanation: Rightsizing involves selecting the appropriate instance type and size for the workload, which can help reduce costs by avoiding over-provisioning and underutilization of resources. This best practice is essential for achieving the most cost-effective architecture in the AWS Cloud.

questions.question: A company is using a third-party service to back up 10 TB of data to a tape library. The on-premises backup server is running out of space. The company wants to use AWS services for the backups without changing its existing backup workflows. Which AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid cloud storage service that allows on-premises applications to seamlessly integrate with cloud-based storage. It can be used to back up data to Amazon S3 without changing the existing backup workflows.

questions.question: Which AWS tool gives users the ability to plan their service usage, service costs, and instance reservations, and also allows them to set custom alerts when their costs or usage exceed established thresholds?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows users to plan their service usage, service costs, and instance reservations, and also allows them to set custom alerts when their costs or usage exceed established thresholds. It provides a more comprehensive view of costs and usage compared to the other options.

questions.question: Which tasks are the customer's responsibility, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for encrypting data on the client-side. This is because the customer has control over the data before it reaches AWS.

questions.question: A developer has been hired by a large company and needs AWS credentials. Which are security best practices that should be followed? (Choose two.)
options: Grant the developer access to only the AWS resources needed to perform the job.
Share the AWS account root user credentials with the developer.
Add the developer to the administrator's group in AWS IAM.
Configure a password policy that ensures the developer's password cannot be changed.
Ensure the account password policy requires a minimum length.
answer: Grant the developer access to only the AWS resources needed to perform the job.
Ensure the account password policy requires a minimum length.
questions.explanation: This is a security best practice as it limits the developer's access to only the necessary resources, reducing the risk of unauthorized access or data breaches. It also aligns with the principle of least privilege.
questions.verified_answer: Grant the developer access to only the AWS resources needed to perform the job.

questions.question: A company has multiple AWS accounts that include compute workloads that cannot be interrupted. The company wants to obtain billing discounts that are based on the company's use of AWS services. Which AWS feature or purchasing option will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Consolidated billing allows multiple AWS accounts to be grouped together under a single master account, enabling the company to take advantage of volume discounts and other benefits. This feature meets the company's requirements for obtaining billing discounts without interrupting compute workloads.

questions.question: A user wants to allow applications running on an Amazon EC2 instance to make calls to other AWS services. The access granted must be secure. Which AWS service or feature should be used?
questions.explanation: IAM roles allow applications running on an Amazon EC2 instance to make calls to other AWS services securely by providing temporary security credentials. This is a more secure approach than using IAM user SSH keys or relying on security groups.

questions.question: A company wants a fully managed Windows file server for its Windows-based applications. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Amazon FSx is a fully managed file system service that supports Windows-based applications, providing a highly available and durable storage solution. It allows users to easily deploy and manage file systems in the cloud.

questions.question: A company wants to migrate its NFS on-premises workload to AWS. Which AWS Storage Gateway type should the company use to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 File Gateway is the correct choice because it allows for the integration of on-premises applications with Amazon S3, enabling the migration of NFS workloads to AWS. It provides a file gateway that can be accessed by on-premises applications using NFS or SMB protocols.

questions.question: A company needs to track the activity in its AWS accounts, and needs to know when an API call is made against its AWS resources. Which AWS tool or service can be used to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail is used to track the activity in AWS accounts, including API calls made against AWS resources. It provides a record of all AWS API calls made within an account, including the identity of the user or role that made the call.

questions.question: A company has an uninterruptible application that runs on Amazon EC2 instances. The application constantly processes a backlog of files in an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. This usage is expected to continue to grow for years. What is the MOST cost-effective EC2 instance purchasing model to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Savings Plans provide a discounted rate for committed usage, making them the most cost-effective option for long-term usage. This is particularly suitable for the company's uninterruptible application that is expected to continue growing for years.

questions.question: A company wants an AWS service to provide product recommendations based on its customer data. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Amazon Personalize is a fully managed service that uses machine learning to provide product recommendations based on customer data. It can be used to build and deploy highly accurate, real-time personalization models.

questions.question: A company is planning its migration to the AWS Cloud. The company is identifying its capability gaps by using the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) perspectives. Which phase of the cloud transformation journey includes these identification activities?
questions.explanation: The Align phase of the cloud transformation journey involves identifying capability gaps and aligning the organization's strategy, culture, and processes with the cloud. This phase is where the company would use the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) perspectives to identify its capability gaps.

questions.question: A social media company wants to protect its web application from common web exploits such as SQL injections and cross-site scripting. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) is designed to protect web applications from common web exploits such as SQL injections and cross-site scripting by filtering HTTP traffic. It can be integrated with AWS resources such as Amazon CloudFront, Elastic Load Balancer, and API Gateway.

questions.question: Which fully managed AWS service assists with the creation, testing, and management of custom Amazon EC2 images?
questions.explanation: EC2 Image Builder is a fully managed service that helps create, test, and manage custom Amazon EC2 images. It automates the process of creating and managing custom images, making it easier to deploy and manage applications.

questions.question: A company wants an automated process to continuously scan its Amazon EC2 instances for software vulnerabilities. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon Inspector is a service that continuously scans Amazon EC2 instances for software vulnerabilities, configuration issues, and best practices. It provides a detailed report of the findings, allowing the company to take corrective action.

questions.question: A company needs to perform data processing once a week that typically takes about 5 hours to complete. Which AWS service should the company use for this workload?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that can handle workloads that take less than 15 minutes to complete. For a workload that takes 5 hours, a serverless service like AWS Lambda is not suitable, but it's still a better choice than Amazon EC2 for this type of workload due to its cost-effectiveness and scalability.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature provides log information of the inbound and outbound traffic on network interfaces in a VPC?
questions.explanation: VPC Flow Logs provides log information of the inbound and outbound traffic on network interfaces in a VPC, allowing for monitoring and analysis of network traffic patterns.

questions.question: A company wants to design a centralized storage system to manage the configuration data and passwords for its critical business applications. Which AWS service or capability will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store is a centralized repository to store configuration data such as passwords, database strings, and other sensitive information. It is the most cost-effective option for storing and managing configuration data and passwords for critical business applications.

questions.question: A company plans to deploy containers on AWS. The company wants full control of the compute resources that host the containers. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 provides a virtualized computing environment, allowing for full control of the compute resources. However, it does not provide a managed container orchestration service, which is typically used with containers.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature allows users to create new AWS accounts, group multiple accounts to organize workflows, and apply policies to groups of accounts?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows users to create new AWS accounts, group multiple accounts to organize workflows, and apply policies to groups of accounts. This service provides a centralized management console for multiple AWS accounts.

questions.question: A company wants to store and retrieve files in Amazon S3 for its existing on-premises applications by using industry-standard file system protocols. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 File Gateway allows existing on-premises applications to store and retrieve files in Amazon S3 using industry-standard file system protocols such as NFS and SMB. This service acts as a file gateway, enabling seamless integration with existing applications.

questions.question: A company wants to block SQL injection attacks. Which AWS service or feature should the company use to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) is a service that helps protect web applications from common web exploits and SQL injection attacks. It can be used to filter traffic and block malicious requests before they reach the application.

questions.question: A company wants a unified tool to provide a consistent method to interact with AWS services. Which AWS service or tool will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: The AWS CLI provides a unified tool to interact with AWS services from the command line, offering a consistent method for users to manage and automate their AWS resources. It supports a wide range of AWS services and allows users to create, update, and delete resources using simple commands.

questions.question: A company needs to evaluate its AWS environment and provide best practice recommendations in five categories: cost, performance, service limits, fault tolerance and security. Which AWS service can the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor is a service that provides best practice recommendations across five categories: cost, performance, security, fault tolerance, and service limits. It helps users optimize their AWS environment and improve its overall health.

questions.question: Which perspective in the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) includes capabilities for configuration management and patch management?
questions.explanation: The Operations perspective in the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) focuses on the day-to-day management of cloud resources, including configuration management and patch management. This perspective ensures that cloud resources are properly configured, patched, and monitored to maintain their security and performance.

questions.question: A company has a compute workload that is steady, predictable, and uninterruptible. Which Amazon EC2 instance purchasing options meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances and Saving Plans are the most cost-effective options for a steady, predictable, and uninterruptible workload because they provide a discounted rate for a committed usage period. This aligns with the requirements of the workload, making them the best choices.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 pricing model is the MOST cost efficient for an uninterruptible workload that runs once a year for 24 hours?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances are the most cost-efficient option for an uninterruptible workload that runs once a year for 24 hours because they charge only for the actual time used, without any upfront commitment or long-term commitment. This makes them suitable for infrequent or unpredictable workloads.

questions.question: Which option is a shared responsibility between AWS and its customers under the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: Configuration of Amazon EC2 instance operating systems
questions.explanation: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, patch management is a shared responsibility between AWS and its customers. AWS is responsible for the underlying infrastructure, while customers are responsible for patching and updating their instance operating systems and applications.

questions.question: A company wants to migrate its on-premises workloads to the AWS Cloud. The company wants to separate workloads for chargeback to different departments. Which AWS services or features will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Consolidated billing allows a single bill to be generated for multiple AWS accounts, making it easier to track costs across departments. Multiple AWS accounts enable separate workloads to be isolated and billed to different departments, meeting the company's chargeback requirements.

questions.question: Which task is a responsibility of AWS, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: Enable client-side encryption for objects that are stored in Amazon S3.
Configure IAM security policies to comply with the principle of least privilege.
Patch the guest operating system on an Amazon EC2 instance.
Apply updates to the Nitro Hypervisor.
questions.answer: Apply updates to the Nitro Hypervisor.
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for the security of the underlying infrastructure, including the Nitro Hypervisor. This includes applying updates to ensure the security and integrity of the hypervisor.
questions.verified_answer: Apply updates to the Nitro Hypervisor.

questions.question: Which option is a benefit of using AWS for cloud computing?
options: Trade variable expense for fixed expense
Spending money running and maintaining data centers
questions.explanation: This is a benefit of using AWS for cloud computing because it allows users to only pay for the resources they use, reducing costs and increasing flexibility. Pay-as-you-go pricing is a key advantage of cloud computing, enabling businesses to scale up or down as needed without being locked into fixed costs.

questions.question: Which option is an AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) business perspective capability?
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) business perspective capabilities include Culture Evolution, which focuses on organizational culture and change management. Data Monetization is not a business capability in the AWS CAF.

questions.question: A company is assessing its AWS Business Support plan to determine if the plan still meets the company's needs. The company is considering switching to AWS Enterprise Support. Which additional benefit will the company receive with AWS Enterprise Support?
options: A full set of AWS Trusted Advisor checks
Phone, email, and chat access to cloud support engineers 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
A designated technical account manager (TAM) to assist in monitoring and optimization
A consultative review and architecture guidance for the company's applications
questions.answer: A designated technical account manager (TAM) to assist in monitoring and optimization
questions.explanation: AWS Enterprise Support includes a designated technical account manager (TAM) to assist in monitoring and optimization, which is not available in the AWS Business Support plan. This TAM provides personalized support and guidance to help the company optimize its use of AWS services.
questions.verified_answer: A designated technical account manager (TAM) to assist in monitoring and optimization

questions.question: Which pricing model will interrupt a running Amazon EC2 instance if capacity becomes temporarily unavailable?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are a type of EC2 instance that can be interrupted if the capacity becomes temporarily unavailable. This is because Spot Instances are priced on a competitive bidding model, where the user bids on the price they are willing to pay for the instance, and AWS can interrupt the instance if a higher bidder is found.

questions.question: Which options are AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) security perspective capabilities? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) security perspective capabilities include incident response and infrastructure protection. These capabilities are part of the security perspective in the AWS CAF, which helps organizations design and implement secure cloud environments.

questions.question: A company wants to run its workload on Amazon EC2 instances for more than 1 year. This workload will run continuously. Which option offers a discounted hourly rate compared to the hourly rate of On-Demand Instances?
questions.explanation: EC2 Instance Savings Plans offer a discounted hourly rate compared to On-Demand Instances for workloads that run continuously for more than 1 year. This is because Savings Plans provide a committed usage rate, allowing customers to save up to 72% on their EC2 usage costs.

questions.question: Which characteristic of the AWS Cloud helps users eliminate underutilized CPU capacity?
questions.explanation: Elasticity in the AWS Cloud allows users to scale their resources up or down based on demand, eliminating underutilized CPU capacity. This means users can quickly increase or decrease their resources to match changing workloads, reducing waste and saving costs.

questions.question: Which AWS services can a company use to achieve a loosely coupled architecture? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) enables loose coupling by allowing different components to send and receive messages without being tightly coupled. AWS Step Functions also promotes loose coupling by allowing different components to be orchestrated and managed in a decoupled manner.
questions.verified_answer: Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS), AWS Step Functions

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud service can send alerts to customers if custom spending thresholds are exceeded?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows users to set custom spending thresholds and receive alerts when those thresholds are exceeded. This service helps users stay on top of their costs and make informed decisions about their AWS spending.

questions.question: A company plans to migrate to the AWS Cloud. The company wants to use the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) to define and track business outcomes as part of its cloud transformation journey. Which AWS CAF governance perspective capability will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: The Benefits management capability in the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) is responsible for defining and tracking business outcomes as part of the cloud transformation journey. This capability helps organizations measure the value and benefits of their cloud adoption.

questions.question: A company needs to quickly and securely move files over long distances between its client and an Amazon S3 bucket. Which S3 feature will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: S3 Transfer Acceleration is a feature that enables fast and secure transfer of files over long distances between a client and an Amazon S3 bucket. It uses a global network of edge locations to accelerate data transfer.

questions.question: A company needs to continuously run an experimental workload on an Amazon EC2 instance and stop the instance after 12 hours. Which instance purchasing option will meet this requirement MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances allow for flexible usage and can be started and stopped as needed, making them suitable for experimental workloads. This option is most cost-effective for short-term or variable workloads, as there are no upfront commitments or long-term contracts.

questions.question: Which cloud transformation journey phase of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) focuses on demonstrating how the cloud helps accelerate business outcomes?
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) 'Launch' phase focuses on demonstrating how the cloud helps accelerate business outcomes by deploying and operating workloads. The 'Envision' phase is about defining the business case and strategy for cloud adoption.

questions.question: Which option is a customer responsibility under the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: Maintenance of underlying hardware of Amazon EC2 instances
questions.explanation: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for the security of their application data, including encryption, access control, and data integrity. This includes ensuring that sensitive data is properly secured and protected from unauthorized access.

questions.question: A company wants its Amazon EC2 instances to operate in a highly available environment, even if there is a natural disaster in a particular geographic area. Which approach will achieve this goal?
options: Use EC2 instances in multiple AWS Regions.
Use EC2 instances in multiple Amazon CloudFront locations.
Use EC2 instances in multiple edge locations.
Use EC2 instances in AWS Local Zones.
questions.answer: Use EC2 instances in multiple AWS Regions.
questions.explanation: This approach ensures that if a natural disaster occurs in a particular geographic area, the EC2 instances in other AWS Regions will remain operational, providing high availability. By distributing instances across multiple Regions, the company can minimize the risk of a single point of failure.
questions.verified_answer: Use EC2 instances in multiple AWS Regions.

questions.question: A company wants to modernize and convert a monolithic application into microservices. The company wants to move the application to AWS. Which migration strategy should the company use?
questions.explanation: The company wants to modernize and convert a monolithic application into microservices, which requires significant changes to the application's architecture. Refactoring is the most suitable strategy for this scenario as it involves breaking down the monolithic application into smaller, independent microservices.

questions.question: A systems administrator created a new IAM user for a developer and assigned the user an access key instead of a user name and password. What is the access key used for?
options: To access the AWS account as the AWS account root user
To access the AWS account through the AWS Management Console
To access the AWS account through a CLI
To access all of a company's AWS accounts
questions.answer: To access the AWS account through a CLI
questions.explanation: An access key is a pair of access key ID and secret access key used to access AWS services through the AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) or other AWS SDKs. It is not used to access the AWS Management Console or the AWS account root user.
questions.verified_answer: To access the AWS account through a CLI

questions.question: Which option is an environment that consists of one or more data centers?
questions.explanation: An Availability Zone is a geographic location within a Region that consists of one or more data centers. AWS Outposts is the correct answer as it is an environment that consists of one or more data centers, either on-premises or in a colocation facility.
