questions.question: Which of the following are features of network ACLs as they are used in the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
options: They evaluate all rules before allowing traffic.
They process rules in order, starting with the lowest numbered rule, when deciding whether to allow traffic.
They operate at the instance level.
answer: They process rules in order, starting with the lowest numbered rule, when deciding whether to allow traffic.
questions.explanation: Network ACLs in AWS are indeed stateless, meaning they do not track the state of a connection. They process rules in order, starting with the lowest numbered rule, which is also correct.
questions.verified_answer: They are stateless. They process rules in order, starting with the lowest numbered rule, when deciding whether to allow traffic.

questions.question: Which capabilities are in the platform perspective of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF)? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The platform perspective of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) focuses on the technology and infrastructure aspects of cloud adoption. Data engineering and Continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) are indeed capabilities within this perspective.
questions.verified_answer: Data engineering, Continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD)

questions.question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for applying the latest security updates and patches for which of the following?
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for the security of the operating system, applications, and any associated data on Amazon EC2 instances. This includes applying the latest security updates and patches.

questions.question: Which Amazon S3 storage class is MOST cost-effective for unknown access patterns?
options: S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access (S3 One Zone-IA)
questions.explanation: S3 Intelligent-Tiering is the most cost-effective storage class for unknown access patterns because it automatically moves objects to the most cost-effective storage class based on access patterns. This eliminates the need for manual tiering and reduces storage costs.

questions.question: Which options are AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) security perspective capabilities? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) security perspective capabilities include incident response and infrastructure protection. These capabilities are part of the security perspective in the AWS CAF, which helps organizations design and implement secure cloud environments.

questions.question: A company has a managed IAM policy that does not grant the necessary permissions for users to accomplish required tasks. How can this be resolved?
options: Use a third-party web application firewall (WAF) managed rule from the AWS Marketplace.
Use AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) to create a customer-managed key.
questions.explanation: A custom IAM policy can be created to grant the necessary permissions for users to accomplish required tasks. This allows for fine-grained control over user access and permissions within the AWS environment.

questions.question: Who is responsible for managing IAM user access and secret keys according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: IAM access and secret keys are static, so there is no need to rotate them.
The customer is responsible for rotating keys.
AWS will rotate the keys whenever required.
The AWS Support team will rotate keys when requested by the customer.
questions.answer: The customer is responsible for rotating keys.
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for managing IAM user access and secret keys, including rotating them to maintain security. This is because the customer has control over their AWS account and its resources.
questions.verified_answer: The customer is responsible for rotating keys.

questions.question: A company needs to run a pre-installed third-party firewall on an Amazon EC2 instance. Which AWS service or feature can provide this solution?
questions.explanation: AWS Marketplace allows users to find, purchase, and deploy software and services, including third-party firewalls, on Amazon EC2 instances. This provides the necessary solution for running a pre-installed third-party firewall.

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud benefit gives a company the ability to quickly deploy cloud resources to access compute, storage, and database infrastructures in a matter of minutes?
questions.explanation: Agility is the ability to quickly deploy cloud resources, allowing companies to access compute, storage, and database infrastructures in a matter of minutes. This is a key benefit of the cloud, enabling businesses to respond quickly to changing needs and opportunities.

questions.question: Which of the following is entirely the responsibility of AWS, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: Development of an IAM password policy
Patching of the guest operating system
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for physical and environmental controls, such as data center security and power infrastructure. This includes the physical security of the data center, power and cooling systems, and environmental controls.

questions.question: A company has an uninterruptible application that runs on Amazon EC2 instances. The application constantly processes a backlog of files in an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. This usage is expected to continue to grow for years. What is the MOST cost-effective EC2 instance purchasing model to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Savings Plans provide a discounted rate for committed usage, making them the most cost-effective option for long-term usage. This is particularly suitable for the company's uninterruptible application that is expected to continue growing for years.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 pricing model is the MOST cost efficient for an uninterruptible workload that runs once a year for 24 hours?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances are the most cost-efficient option for an uninterruptible workload that runs once a year for 24 hours because they charge only for the actual time used, without any upfront commitment or long-term commitment. This makes them suitable for infrequent or unpredictable workloads.

questions.question: Which cloud computing advantage is a company applying when it uses AWS Regions to increase application availability to users in different countries?
questions.explanation: Using AWS Regions to increase application availability to users in different countries is an example of leveraging the global reach of cloud computing. This allows companies to deploy applications closer to their users, reducing latency and improving overall user experience.

questions.question: Which action is a security best practice for access to sensitive data that is stored in an Amazon S3 bucket?
options: Enable S3 Cross-Region Replication (CRR) on the S3 bucket.
Use IAM roles for applications that require access to the S3 bucket.
Configure AWS WAF to prevent unauthorized access to the S3 bucket.
Configure Amazon GuardDuty to prevent unauthorized access to the S3 bucket.
questions.answer: Use IAM roles for applications that require access to the S3 bucket.
questions.explanation: Using IAM roles for applications that require access to the S3 bucket is a security best practice as it allows for fine-grained access control and ensures that access is granted only to authorized applications. This approach also helps to reduce the risk of credentials being compromised.
questions.verified_answer: Use IAM roles for applications that require access to the S3 bucket.

questions.question: A company plans to migrate to the AWS Cloud. The company wants to use the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) to define and track business outcomes as part of its cloud transformation journey. Which AWS CAF governance perspective capability will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: The Benefits management capability in the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) is responsible for defining and tracking business outcomes as part of the cloud transformation journey. This capability helps organizations measure the value and benefits of their cloud adoption.

questions.question: A company is assessing its AWS Business Support plan to determine if the plan still meets the company’s needs. The company is considering switching to AWS Enterprise Support. Which additional benefit will the company receive with AWS Enterprise Support?
options: A full set of AWS Trusted Advisor checks
Phone, email, and chat access to cloud support engineers 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
A designated technical account manager (TAM) to assist in monitoring and optimization
A consultative review and architecture guidance for the company’s applications
questions.answer: A designated technical account manager (TAM) to assist in monitoring and optimization
questions.explanation: AWS Enterprise Support includes a designated technical account manager (TAM) to assist in monitoring and optimization, which is not available in the AWS Business Support plan. This TAM provides personalized support and guidance to help the company optimize its use of AWS services.
questions.verified_answer: A designated technical account manager (TAM) to assist in monitoring and optimization

questions.question: A company has decided to adopt Amazon EC2 infrastructure and wants to scale various stateless services for short-term usage. Which EC2 pricing model is MOST cost efficient to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are the most cost-efficient option for short-term usage of stateless services, as they allow for significant cost savings by bidding on unused EC2 capacity. This pricing model is ideal for applications that can be interrupted or scaled down quickly without significant impact on the business.

questions.question: A company is migrating its on-premises server to an Amazon EC2 instance. The server must stay active at all times for the next 12 months. Which EC2 pricing option is the MOST cost-effective for the company’s workload?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide a significant discount compared to On-Demand pricing, making them the most cost-effective option for workloads that need to run continuously for an extended period. This is because Reserved Instances require a one-time upfront payment and a recurring annual payment in exchange for a guaranteed capacity for a specified period.

questions.question: A company is deploying a machine learning (ML) research project that will require a lot of compute power over several months. The ML processing jobs do not need to run at specific times. Which Amazon EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements at the lowest cost?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances provide the lowest cost option for EC2 instances, as they allow AWS to allocate unused capacity at a discounted rate. Since the ML processing jobs do not need to run at specific times, Spot Instances are a suitable choice as they can be interrupted or terminated if the instance is needed for a higher-priority task.

questions.question: A company wants to monitor for misconfigured security groups that are allowing unrestricted access to specific ports. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Amazon GuardDuty is an AWS service that continuously monitors and analyzes network and account activity to identify potential security threats. It can detect misconfigured security groups and alert the user to potential security risks.

questions.question: A company wants to assess its operational readiness. It also wants to identify and mitigate any operational risks ahead of a new product launch. Which AWS Support plan offers guidance and support for this kind of event at no additional charge?
questions.explanation: AWS Enterprise Support provides 24/7 access to the AWS Support API, AWS Trusted Advisor, and AWS Support Engineers who can offer guidance and support for critical issues, including operational readiness and risk mitigation. This support is available at no additional charge for eligible business and enterprise customers.

questions.question: Which type of AWS storage is ephemeral and is deleted when an Amazon EC2 instance is stopped or terminated?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 instance store is a type of ephemeral storage that is deleted when an Amazon EC2 instance is stopped or terminated. It is a local storage that is directly attached to the instance and is not persistent across instance restarts or terminations.

questions.question: A company wants to provide managed Windows virtual desktops and applications to its remote employees over secure network connections. Which AWS services can the company use to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon AppStream 2.0 provides managed Windows virtual desktops and applications over secure network connections, while Amazon WorkSpaces provides managed Windows desktops in the cloud. Both services meet the company's requirements.

questions.question: Which AWS service or resource provides answers to the most frequently asked security-related questions that AWS receives from its users?
questions.explanation: The AWS Knowledge Center is a resource that provides answers to frequently asked security-related questions, as well as other general questions about AWS services and features. It is a valuable resource for users to find information and resolve issues quickly.

questions.question: An online gaming company needs to choose a purchasing option to run its Amazon EC2 instances for 1 year. The web traffic is consistent, and any increases in traffic are predictable. The EC2 instances must be online and available without any disruption. Which EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost effectively?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide a significant discount compared to On-Demand Instances, making them the most cost-effective option for consistent and predictable workloads. They also ensure that the instances are always available without any disruption.

questions.question: A company plans to use an Amazon Snowball Edge device to transfer files to the AWS Cloud. Which activities related to a Snowball Edge device are available to the company at no cost?
options: Use of the Snowball Edge appliance for a 10-day period
The transfer of data out of Amazon S3 and to the Snowball Edge appliance
The transfer of data from the Snowball Edge appliance into Amazon S3
Daily use of the Snowball Edge appliance after 10 days
questions.answer: The transfer of data from the Snowball Edge appliance into Amazon S3
questions.explanation: The transfer of data from the Snowball Edge appliance into Amazon S3 is free of charge. This is because Amazon charges for the use of the device, but not for the data transfer itself.
questions.verified_answer: The transfer of data from the Snowball Edge appliance into Amazon S3

questions.question: Which of the following is the customer’s responsibility under the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)
options: Maintain the configuration of infrastructure devices.
Maintain patching and updates within the hardware infrastructure.
Maintain the configuration of guest operating systems and applications.
answer: Maintain the configuration of guest operating systems and applications.
questions.explanation: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for maintaining the configuration of guest operating systems and applications, as well as making decisions involving encryption options. This is because the customer has control over these components, whereas AWS is responsible for the underlying infrastructure.
verified_answer: Maintain the configuration of guest operating systems and applications.

questions.question: A company wants an AWS service to collect and process 10 TB of data locally and transfer the data to AWS. The company has intermittent connectivity. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball Edge is a data transfer service that can collect and process data locally, and then transfer it to AWS. It's suitable for large-scale data transfers and can handle intermittent connectivity.

questions.question: Which AWS service or component allows inbound traffic from the internet to access a VPC?
questions.explanation: An internet gateway allows inbound and outbound traffic to and from the internet to a VPC. It is a virtual component that enables communication between instances in a VPC and the internet.

questions.question: A company wants to modernize and convert a monolithic application into microservices. The company wants to move the application to AWS. Which migration strategy should the company use?
questions.explanation: The company wants to modernize and convert a monolithic application into microservices, which requires significant changes to the application's architecture. Refactoring is the most suitable strategy for this scenario as it involves breaking down the monolithic application into smaller, independent microservices.

questions.question: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework refers to the ability of a system to recover from infrastructure or service disruptions and dynamically acquire computing resources to meet demand?
questions.explanation: The Reliability pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework focuses on the ability of a system to recover from infrastructure or service disruptions and dynamically acquire computing resources to meet demand. This includes designing systems to be highly available, fault-tolerant, and scalable.

questions.question: A company created an Amazon EC2 instance. The company wants to control the incoming and outgoing network traffic at the instance level. Which AWS resource or service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Security groups act as a virtual firewall at the instance level, controlling incoming and outgoing network traffic. They can be used to allow or deny traffic based on specific rules.

questions.question: A customer runs an On-Demand Amazon Linux EC2 instance for 3 hours, 5 minutes, and 6 seconds. For how much time will the customer be billed?
questions.explanation: The customer will be billed for the full 3 hours, plus the additional 6 minutes, as the billing is rounded up to the nearest minute. The 5 minutes and 6 seconds are not significant enough to affect the billing.

questions.question: A team of researchers is going to collect data at remote locations around the world. Many locations do not have internet connectivity. The team needs to capture the data in the f ield, and transfer it to the AWS Cloud later. Which AWS service will support these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Snow Family is a set of physical devices that can be shipped to remote locations to collect and transfer data to the AWS Cloud, making it suitable for locations without internet connectivity. This service supports the team's requirement to capture data in the field and transfer it to the AWS Cloud later.

questions.question: A company wants a web application to interact with various AWS services. Which AWS service or resource will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: The AWS Management Console is a web-based interface that allows users to interact with various AWS services. It provides a user-friendly interface for managing and configuring AWS resources.

questions.question: Which option is an AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) platform perspective capability?
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) is a structured approach to adopting cloud computing within an organization. Data architecture is a key capability within the platform perspective of the AWS CAF, focusing on designing and implementing data management systems in the cloud.

questions.question: A company wants to launch multiple workloads on AWS. Each workload is related to a different business unit. The company wants to separate and track costs for each business unit. Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?
options: Use AWS Organizations and create one account for each business unit.
Use a spreadsheet to control the owners and cost of each resource.
Use an Amazon DynamoDB table to record costs for each business unit.
Use the AWS Billing console to assign owners to resources and track costs.
questions.answer: Use the AWS Billing console to assign owners to resources and track costs.
questions.explanation: This solution meets the requirements with the least operational overhead as it leverages the built-in features of the AWS Billing console to assign owners and track costs, eliminating the need for additional infrastructure or manual tracking methods.
questions.verified_answer: Use the AWS Billing console to assign owners to resources and track costs.

questions.question: Which responsibility belongs to AWS when a company hosts its databases on Amazon EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: When hosting databases on Amazon EC2 instances, the company is responsible for database software patches, while AWS is responsible for operating system patches. This is because the company has control over the database software, but AWS manages the underlying operating system.

questions.question: Which AWS service converts text to lifelike voices?
questions.explanation: Amazon Polly is a service that converts text to lifelike voices, allowing for the creation of realistic speech synthesis. It uses advanced deep learning technologies to synthesize natural-sounding human speech.

questions.question: A global company wants to use a managed security service for protection from SQL injection attacks. The service also must provide detailed logging information about access to the company’s ecommerce applications. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) provides protection from SQL injection attacks and can be integrated with AWS services to provide detailed logging information. It can also be used to monitor and protect web applications from common web exploits.

questions.question: Which option is an AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) business perspective capability?
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) business perspective capabilities include Culture Evolution, which focuses on organizational culture and change management. Data Monetization is not a business capability in the AWS CAF.

questions.question: A company uses AWS security services and tools. The company needs a service to help manage the security alerts and must organize the alerts into a single dashboard. Which AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Security Hub is a service that provides a centralized dashboard to manage and organize security alerts from various AWS services. It helps to streamline security operations and provides a unified view of security-related data.

questions.question: A company wants to design a centralized storage system to manage the configuration data and passwords for its critical business applications. Which AWS service or capability will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: AWS Secrets Manager is the most cost-effective option for securely storing and managing sensitive data such as passwords and configuration data. It provides features like encryption, rotation, and access control, making it suitable for critical business applications.

questions.question: How does the AWS Enterprise Support Concierge team help users?
options: Answering questions regarding technical support cases
questions.explanation: The AWS Enterprise Support Concierge team is a dedicated team that assists with billing and account inquiries, providing a personalized experience for customers. They help with account management, billing, and other related issues.

questions.question: A company has teams that have different job roles and responsibilities. The company’s employees often change teams. The company needs to manage permissions for the employees so that the permissions are appropriate for the job responsibilities. Which IAM resource should the company use to meet this requirement with the LEAST operational overhead?
questions.explanation: IAM roles provide a way to manage permissions for employees based on their job responsibilities, and can be easily changed as employees move to different teams. This approach has the least operational overhead compared to managing permissions for individual users or instances.

questions.question: Which AWS service gives users the ability to discover and protect sensitive data that is stored in Amazon S3 buckets?
questions.explanation: Amazon Macie is a service that uses machine learning to discover and protect sensitive data stored in Amazon S3 buckets. It helps identify and classify sensitive data, such as personal identifiable information (PII), and provides recommendations for remediation.

questions.question: Which option is a customer responsibility when using Amazon DynamoDB under the AWS Shared Responsibility Model?
options: Encryption of data at rest in DynamoDB
questions.explanation: Under the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, customers are responsible for managing access to their DynamoDB tables, including user authentication and authorization. This includes controlling who has access to the tables and what actions they can perform on them.

questions.question: Which AWS service or tool can be used to set up a firewall to control traffic going into and coming out of an Amazon VPC subnet?
questions.explanation: A Network ACL is a stateless firewall that controls inbound and outbound traffic to and from a subnet in a VPC. It is used to filter traffic based on IP addresses and ports.

questions.question: Which AWS services or tools can identify rightsizing opportunities for Amazon EC2 instances? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Cost Explorer provides detailed cost and usage analysis, but it doesn't specifically identify rightsizing opportunities. AWS Compute Optimizer, on the other hand, is designed to identify opportunities to optimize Amazon EC2 instance types and sizes, reducing costs and improving performance.
questions.verified_answer: AWS Cost Explorer, AWS Compute Optimizer

questions.question: A company has migrated its workloads to AWS. The company wants to adopt AWS at scale and operate more efficiently and securely. Which AWS service or framework should the company use for operational support?
questions.explanation: The AWS Well-Architected Framework is a set of best practices and tools that help companies build secure, high-performing, and efficient workloads on AWS. It provides operational support by identifying areas for improvement and providing guidance on how to optimize AWS resources.

questions.question: Which AWS tool gives users the ability to plan their service usage, service costs, and instance reservations, and also allows them to set custom alerts when their costs or usage exceed established thresholds?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows users to plan their service usage, service costs, and instance reservations, and also allows them to set custom alerts when their costs or usage exceed established thresholds. It provides a more comprehensive view of costs and usage compared to the other options.

questions.question: Which task is the responsibility of AWS when using AWS services?
options: Creation of security group rules for outbound access
Maintenance of physical and environmental controls
Application of Amazon EC2 operating system patches
questions.answer: Maintenance of physical and environmental controls
questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for managing IAM user permissions, but the other options are incorrect. Management of IAM user permissions is a key responsibility of AWS, as it allows users to control access to AWS resources.

questions.question: A company wants to migrate its PostgreSQL database to AWS. The company does not use the database frequently. Which AWS service or resource will meet these requirements with the LEAST management overhead?
questions.explanation: Amazon Aurora Serverless is the most suitable option for infrequently used databases as it automatically scales up or down based on demand, reducing management overhead. It also provides a cost-effective solution as it only charges for the actual time the database is in use.

questions.question: Which of the following is a way to use Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups to scale capacity in the AWS Cloud?
options: Scale the number of EC2 instances in or out automatically, based on demand.
Scale the size of EC2 instances up or down automatically, based on demand.
Transfer unused CPU resources between EC2 instances.
questions.answer: Scale the number of EC2 instances in or out automatically, based on demand.
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling allows you to scale the number of EC2 instances in or out automatically based on demand, which helps to ensure that your application has the necessary resources to handle changes in workload. This is a key feature of Auto Scaling, allowing you to dynamically adjust your instance count in response to changing demand.
questions.verified_answer: Scale the number of EC2 instances in or out automatically, based on demand.

questions.question: Which actions are the responsibility of AWS, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)
options: Patching the operating system on Amazon EC2 instances
Enforcing a strict password policy for IAM users
Patching the operating system on Amazon RDS instances
Configuring security groups and network ACLs
answer: Patching the operating system on Amazon RDS instances
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for securing the virtualization layer, which includes the hypervisor and the underlying infrastructure. This is because AWS manages the underlying infrastructure, including the virtualization layer.

questions.question: Which task is a responsibility of AWS, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: Configure identity and access management for applications.
Manage encryption options for data that is stored on AWS.
Configure security groups for Amazon EC2 instances.
Maintain the physical hardware of the infrastructure.
questions.answer: Maintain the physical hardware of the infrastructure.
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for maintaining the physical hardware of the infrastructure, including servers, storage, and networking equipment. This is because AWS has control over the underlying infrastructure and is responsible for ensuring its security and reliability.
questions.verified_answer: Maintain the physical hardware of the infrastructure.

questions.question: Which AWS services or features give users the ability to create a network connection between two VPCs? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: VPC peering allows users to create a network connection between two VPCs in the same account, while AWS Transit Gateway enables users to create a hub-and-spoke network architecture, connecting multiple VPCs to a central gateway.

questions.question: Which capabilities are in the platform perspective of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF)? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The platform perspective of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) focuses on the technology and infrastructure aspects of cloud adoption. Data engineering and Continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) are indeed capabilities within this perspective.
questions.verified_answer: Data engineering, Continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD)

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a single location to track the progress of application migrations?
questions.explanation: AWS Migration Hub provides a single location to track the progress of application migrations, making it easier to manage and monitor migrations across multiple AWS services. It helps to track the progress of migrations, identify potential issues, and optimize the migration process.

questions.question: A company wants to create templates that the company can reuse to deploy multiple AWS resources. Which AWS service or feature can the company use to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation is a service that allows users to create and manage templates for deploying multiple AWS resources. These templates can be reused to deploy resources consistently and reliably across different environments.

questions.question: A company needs to use third-party software for its workload on AWS. Which AWS service or feature can the company use to purchase the software?
questions.explanation: AWS Marketplace is a digital catalog where customers can browse, purchase, and deploy software and data services from independent software vendors. It allows customers to easily find, purchase, and deploy third-party software on AWS.

questions.question: A company needs to continuously run an experimental workload on an Amazon EC2 instance and stop the instance after 12 hours. Which instance purchasing option will meet this requirement MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances allow for flexible usage and can be started and stopped as needed, making them suitable for experimental workloads. This option is most cost-effective for short-term or variable workloads, as there are no upfront commitments or long-term contracts.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature allows users to create new AWS accounts, group multiple accounts to organize workflows, and apply policies to groups of accounts?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows users to create new AWS accounts, group multiple accounts to organize workflows, and apply policies to groups of accounts. This service provides a centralized management console for multiple AWS accounts.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature can a company use to apply security rules to specific Amazon EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Security groups are a virtual firewall that controls inbound and outbound traffic to and from an Amazon EC2 instance. They can be applied to specific instances to apply security rules.

questions.question: A company is storing data that will not be frequently accessed in the AWS Cloud. If the company needs to access the data, the data needs to be retrieved within 12 hours. The company wants a solution that is cost-effective for storage costs for each gigabyte. Which Amazon S3 storage class will meet these requirements?
options: S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access (S3 One Zone-IA)
questions.explanation: S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval is a cost-effective storage class for infrequently accessed data, allowing retrieval within 12 hours. It is suitable for data that is not frequently accessed but still needs to be retrieved within a short time frame.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature can be used to create a private connection between an on-premises workload and an AWS Cloud workload?
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect is a service that enables a dedicated network connection from an on-premises workload to AWS, providing a private and secure connection. This allows for low-latency and high-bandwidth connectivity between on-premises and cloud workloads.

questions.question: Which option is a benefit of the economies of scale based on the advantages of cloud computing?
options: The ability to trade variable expense for fixed expense
Lower variable costs over fixed costs
Increased operational costs across data centers
questions.answer: Lower variable costs over fixed costs
questions.explanation: Economies of scale in cloud computing allow businesses to reduce their costs by spreading fixed expenses across a large user base, resulting in lower variable costs compared to traditional on-premises infrastructure.
questions.verified_answer: Lower variable costs over fixed costs

questions.question: A company wants to make an upfront commitment for continued use of its production Amazon EC2 instances in exchange for a reduced overall cost. Which pricing options meet these requirements with the LOWEST cost? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances and Savings Plans both offer upfront commitments in exchange for reduced costs. They are the most cost-effective options for making an upfront commitment for continued use of production Amazon EC2 instances.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used at no additional cost?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations is a service that allows you to consolidate and manage multiple AWS accounts, and it is included at no additional cost. This service helps you to organize your AWS resources and manage access to them.

questions.question: Elasticity in the AWS Cloud refers to which of the following? (Choose two.)
options: How quickly an Amazon EC2 instance can be restarted
The ability to rightsize resources as demand shifts
The maximum amount of RAM an Amazon EC2 instance can use
How easily resources can be procured when they are needed
answer: The ability to rightsize resources as demand shifts
How easily resources can be procured when they are needed
questions.explanation: Elasticity in the AWS Cloud refers to the ability to quickly scale resources up or down in response to changing demands. This includes the ability to rightsize resources as demand shifts and procure resources easily when needed.
questions.verified_answer: The ability to rightsize resources as demand shifts, How easily resources can be procured when they are needed

questions.question: A company runs thousands of simultaneous simulations using AWS Batch. Each simulation is stateless, is fault tolerant, and runs for up to 3 hours. Which pricing model enables the company to optimize costs and meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances allow the company to optimize costs by bidding on unused EC2 capacity, which is suitable for stateless, fault-tolerant simulations. This pricing model also meets the requirement of running for up to 3 hours, as Spot Instances can be interrupted after the bid expires.

questions.question: Which tasks are customer responsibilities, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)
options: Configure the AWS provided security group firewall.
Classify company assets in the AWS Cloud.
Determine which Availability Zones to use for Amazon S3 buckets.
Select Amazon EC2 instances to run AWS Lambda on.
answer: Configure the AWS provided security group firewall.
Classify company assets in the AWS Cloud.
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for configuring their own security settings, including security groups. They are also responsible for classifying and managing their own company assets in the cloud.
questions.verified_answer: Configure the AWS provided security group firewall. Classify company assets in the AWS Cloud.

questions.question: An e-learning platform needs to run an application for 2 months each year. The application will be deployed on Amazon EC2 instances. Any application downtime during those 2 months must be avoided. Which EC2 purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide a discounted hourly rate for a one- or three-year commitment, making them the most cost-effective option for a specific usage pattern like this. On-Demand Instances, while flexible, do not offer the same level of cost savings as Reserved Instances.

questions.question: A company wants to manage deployed IT services and govern its infrastructure as code (IaC) templates. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS Service Catalog allows users to manage deployed IT services and govern infrastructure as code (IaC) templates by providing a centralized platform for managing and sharing approved services, applications, and configurations. It enables organizations to standardize and govern their infrastructure and services.

questions.question: A company wants to provision and manage its AWS infrastructure by using the common programming languages Typescript, Python, Java, and .NET. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK) is an open-source framework that allows developers to define cloud infrastructure in code using familiar programming languages such as Typescript, Python, Java, and .NET. It provides a consistent and efficient way to provision and manage AWS infrastructure.

questions.question: A company wants to quickly implement a continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS CodeStar is a service that helps to quickly implement a CI/CD pipeline by providing a set of tools and features to manage and automate the development process. It integrates with other AWS services such as AWS CodeCommit, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS CodeDeploy to provide a comprehensive CI/CD solution.

questions.question: A company is using a third-party service to back up 10 TB of data to a tape library. The on-premises backup server is running out of space. The company wants to use AWS services for the backups without changing its existing backup workflows. Which AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid cloud storage service that allows on-premises applications to seamlessly integrate with cloud-based storage. It can be used to back up data to Amazon S3 without changing the existing backup workflows.

questions.question: A company needs a central user portal so that users can log in to third-party business applications that support Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) 2.0. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
options: AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On)
questions.explanation: Amazon Cognito is primarily used for user identity and access management, but it does not support SAML 2.0 for third-party business applications. AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On) is the correct choice as it provides a central user portal for logging into third-party applications that support SAML 2.0.
questions.verified_answer: AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On)

questions.question: Which option is a shared responsibility between AWS and its customers under the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: Configuration of Amazon EC2 instance operating systems
questions.explanation: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, patch management is a shared responsibility between AWS and its customers. AWS is responsible for the underlying infrastructure, while customers are responsible for patching and updating their instance operating systems and applications.

questions.question: A company plans to deploy containers on AWS. The company wants full control of the compute resources that host the containers. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 provides a virtualized computing environment, allowing for full control of the compute resources. However, it does not provide a managed container orchestration service, which is typically used with containers.

questions.question: Which option is a benefit of using AWS for cloud computing?
options: Trade variable expense for fixed expense
Spending money running and maintaining data centers
questions.explanation: This is a benefit of using AWS for cloud computing because it allows users to only pay for the resources they use, reducing costs and increasing flexibility. Pay-as-you-go pricing is a key advantage of cloud computing, enabling businesses to scale up or down as needed without being locked into fixed costs.

questions.question: A user wants to allow applications running on an Amazon EC2 instance to make calls to other AWS services. The access granted must be secure. Which AWS service or feature should be used?
questions.explanation: IAM roles allow applications running on an Amazon EC2 instance to make calls to other AWS services securely by providing temporary security credentials. This is a more secure approach than using IAM user SSH keys or relying on security groups.

questions.question: Which options are AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) governance perspective capabilities? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) governance perspective focuses on managing and governing cloud resources. Cloud financial management and Application portfolio management are two key capabilities within this perspective.
questions.verified_answer: Cloud financial management, Application portfolio management

questions.question: A company wants to establish a private network connection between AWS and its corporate network. Which AWS service or feature will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect is a network service that makes it possible to establish a dedicated network connection from an on-premises network to AWS. This allows for a private and secure connection between the corporate network and AWS.

questions.question: A company is designing its AWS workloads so that components can be updated regularly and so that changes can be made in small, reversible increments. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this design support?
questions.explanation: This design supports Operational excellence because it focuses on making changes in small, reversible increments, which is a key principle of continuous improvement and minimizing downtime. This approach aligns with the Operational excellence pillar's goal of running operations efficiently and effectively.

questions.question: A company wants to allow users to authenticate and authorize multiple AWS accounts by using a single set of credentials. Which AWS service or resource will meet this requirement?
options: AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On)
questions.answer: AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On)
questions.explanation: AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On) allows users to authenticate and authorize multiple AWS accounts using a single set of credentials, making it the correct choice. This service provides a centralized identity and access management solution for AWS accounts.
questions.verified_answer: AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On)

questions.question: A company wants to use the AWS Cloud to deploy an application globally. Which architecture deployment model should the company use to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: To deploy an application globally, a company should use a Multi-Region architecture deployment model, which allows them to deploy their application in multiple AWS regions around the world. This approach enables the company to provide low-latency and high-availability access to their application for users in different geographic locations.

questions.question: A company wants to use the AWS Cloud to deploy an application globally. Which architecture deployment model should the company use to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: A Multi-Region architecture deployment model allows the company to deploy their application across multiple AWS Regions, providing low latency and high availability for users globally. This model is suitable for applications that require global reach and can handle different regulatory requirements across regions.

questions.question: A company is migrating its applications from on-premises to the AWS Cloud. The company wants to ensure that the applications are assigned only the minimum permissions that are needed to perform all operations. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) allows you to manage access to AWS services and resources by creating and managing security credentials, such as access keys and user identities. It also enables you to define fine-grained permissions for users and roles, ensuring that they have only the minimum permissions needed to perform their tasks.

questions.question: A company needs to move 75 petabytes of data from its on-premises data centers to AWS. Which AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements MOST cost effectively?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowmobile is the most cost-effective option for transferring large amounts of data to AWS, as it can handle up to 100 PB of data in a single shipment. It is designed for large-scale data migrations and provides a secure and efficient way to transfer data to the cloud.

questions.question: A company is planning to migrate its application to the AWS Cloud. Which AWS tool or set of resources should the company use to analyze and assess its readiness for migration?
questions.explanation: The AWS Well-Architected Framework is a set of best practices and tools that helps identify and address operational and security risks in the cloud. It provides a structured approach to evaluate and improve the design and operation of workloads in the cloud.

questions.question: Which design principles should a company apply to AWS Cloud workloads to maximize sustainability and minimize environmental impact? (Choose two.)
options: Maximize utilization of Amazon EC2 instances.
Minimize utilization of Amazon EC2 instances.
Force frequent application reinstallations by users.
Reduce the need for users to reinstall applications.
answer: Maximize utilization of Amazon EC2 instances.
Reduce the need for users to reinstall applications.
questions.explanation: Maximizing utilization of Amazon EC2 instances can help reduce the number of instances needed, thus reducing energy consumption. Reducing the need for users to reinstall applications can also help minimize the environmental impact by reducing the number of resources required for application installations and updates.
questions.verified_answer: Maximize utilization of Amazon EC2 instances. Reduce the need for users to reinstall applications.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides the ability to host a NoSQL database in the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast, fully managed item storage and retrieval. It is designed to handle large amounts of data and scale as needed.

questions.question: A company wants to integrate natural language processing (NLP) into business intelligence (BI) dashboards. The company wants to ask questions and receive answers with relevant visualizations. Which AWS service or tool will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon QuickSight Q is a natural language query (NLQ) capability that allows users to ask questions and receive answers with relevant visualizations, making it suitable for the company's requirements. It integrates with Amazon QuickSight, a fast, cloud-powered business intelligence service that makes it easy to visualize and analyze data.

questions.question: What does Amazon CloudFront provide?
options: Automatic scaling for all resources to power an application from a single unified
Secure delivery of data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency
Ability to directly manage traffic globally through a variety of routing types, including latency-based routing, geo DNS, geoproximity, and weighted round robin
Automatic distribution of incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as Amazon EC2 instances, containers, IP addresses, and AWS Lambda functions
questions.answer: Secure delivery of data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency. It does this by caching content at edge locations around the world, reducing the distance between users and the content they request.
questions.verified_answer: Secure delivery of data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency

questions.question: A company wants to deploy some of its resources in the AWS Cloud. To meet regulatory requirements, the data must remain local and on premises. There must be low latency between AWS and the company resources. Which AWS service or feature can be used to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Outposts allows companies to deploy AWS resources on-premises, meeting the regulatory requirement of keeping data local. It also provides low latency between AWS and on-premises resources.

questions.question: In which ways does the AWS Cloud offer lower total cost of ownership (TCO) of computing resources than on-premises data centers? (Choose two.)
options: AWS replaces upfront capital expenditures with pay-as-you-go costs.
AWS is designed for high availability, which eliminates user downtime.
AWS eliminates the need for on-premises IT staff.
AWS uses economies of scale to continually reduce prices.
AWS offers a single pricing model for Amazon EC2 instances.
answer: AWS replaces upfront capital expenditures with pay-as-you-go costs.
AWS uses economies of scale to continually reduce prices.
questions.explanation: The given answer is correct because AWS Cloud offers lower TCO by replacing upfront capital expenditures with pay-as-you-go costs, allowing businesses to avoid large upfront expenses. Additionally, AWS uses economies of scale to continually reduce prices, making it a cost-effective option for computing resources.
verified_answer: AWS replaces upfront capital expenditures with pay-as-you-go costs.
AWS uses economies of scale to continually reduce prices.

questions.question: A company often does not use all of its current Amazon EC2 capacity to run stateless workloads. The company wants to optimize its EC2 costs. Which EC2 instance type will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances allow the company to run stateless workloads at a discounted rate, as long as they are willing to accept interruption. This is ideal for workloads that do not require a fixed amount of resources at all times.

questions.question: A company has deployed an Amazon EC2 instance. Which option is an AWS responsibility under the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: Installing updates and security patches of guest operating system
Configuration of security groups on each instance
questions.explanation: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for the management of the underlying infrastructure, including installing updates and security patches of the guest operating system. This is a key aspect of maintaining the security and reliability of the EC2 instance.
questions.verified_answer: Installing updates and security patches of guest operating system

questions.question: A company plans to migrate its application to AWS and run the application on Amazon EC2 instances. The application will have continuous usage for 1 year. Which EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide a significant discount compared to On-Demand Instances, making them the most cost-effective option for continuous usage. This is because Reserved Instances require a one-time upfront payment and a lower hourly rate for the reserved instance.

questions.question: A company wants to migrate its NFS on-premises workload to AWS. Which AWS Storage Gateway type should the company use to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 File Gateway is the correct choice because it allows for the integration of on-premises applications with Amazon S3, enabling the migration of NFS workloads to AWS. It provides a file gateway that can be accessed by on-premises applications using NFS or SMB protocols.

questions.question: What does the concept of agility mean in AWS Cloud computing? (Choose two.)
options: The speed at which AWS resources are implemented
The speed at which AWS creates new AWS Regions
The low cost of entry into cloud computing
answer: The speed at which AWS resources are implemented
questions.explanation: Agility in AWS Cloud computing refers to the ability to quickly implement resources and experiment with new ideas, allowing for faster development and deployment of applications. This enables businesses to be more responsive to changing market conditions and customer needs.
verified_answer: The speed at which AWS resources are implemented

questions.question: Which AWS service supports the deployment and management of applications in the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk is a service that allows users to deploy and manage web applications and services in the AWS Cloud. It supports a variety of platforms, including .NET, Java, Python, and Ruby, among others.

questions.question: A company wants an AWS service to provide product recommendations based on its customer data. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Amazon Personalize is a fully managed service that uses machine learning to provide product recommendations based on customer data. It can be used to build and deploy highly accurate, real-time personalization models.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides highly durable object storage?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is a highly durable object storage service that stores data as objects within buckets. It provides a highly available and durable storage solution for data archiving, backup, and disaster recovery.

questions.question: A network engineer needs to build a hybrid cloud architecture connecting on premises networks to the AWS Cloud using AWS Direct Connect. The company has a few VPCs in a single AWS Region and expects to increase the number of VPCs to hundreds over time. Which AWS service or feature should the engineer use to simplify and scale this connectivity as the VPCs increase in number?
questions.explanation: AWS Transit Gateway is a network service that makes it easier to connect multiple VPCs to each other, as well as to on-premises networks, making it a suitable choice for this scenario. It simplifies and scales connectivity as the number of VPCs increases.

questions.question: Which AWS service can run a managed PostgreSQL database that provides online transaction processing (OLTP)?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS provides a managed relational database service that supports various database engines, including PostgreSQL. It is well-suited for online transaction processing (OLTP) workloads due to its high performance, reliability, and scalability features.

questions.question: Which of the following is a recommended design principle for AWS Cloud architecture?
options: Build a single application component that can handle all the application functionality.
Make large changes on fewer iterations to reduce chances of failure.
Avoid monolithic architecture by segmenting workloads.
questions.answer: Avoid monolithic architecture by segmenting workloads.
questions.explanation: This design principle is recommended to improve scalability, fault tolerance, and maintainability of AWS Cloud architecture. By segmenting workloads, applications can be more easily updated, scaled, and managed.
questions.verified_answer: Avoid monolithic architecture by segmenting workloads.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides the ability to manage infrastructure as code?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation is a service that allows users to manage and provision infrastructure as code, providing a template-driven approach to create and manage AWS resources. This enables infrastructure to be version-controlled, reviewed, and reproducible.

questions.question: A developer wants to deploy an application quickly on AWS without manually creating the required resources.Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk is a service that allows developers to deploy web applications and services without worrying about the underlying infrastructure. It supports a variety of platforms, including .NET, Node.js, Python, Ruby, and more.

questions.question: A company is running and managing its own Docker environment on Amazon EC2 instances. The company wants an alternative to help manage cluster size, scheduling, and environment maintenance. Which AWS service meets these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers that can manage cluster size, scheduling, and environment maintenance, making it a suitable alternative for the company's Docker environment. It allows users to run containers without worrying about the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question: Which option is a perspective that includes foundational capabilities of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF)?
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) is a business-focused approach to cloud adoption, and governance is one of its foundational capabilities. Governance encompasses the policies, procedures, and standards that ensure the secure and efficient use of cloud resources.

questions.question: Which AWS service supports a hybrid architecture that gives users the ability to extend AWS infrastructure, AWS services, APIs, and tools to data centers, co-location environments, or on-premises facilities?
questions.explanation: AWS Outposts is a service that allows users to extend AWS infrastructure, services, APIs, and tools to data centers, co-location environments, or on-premises facilities, enabling a hybrid architecture. This allows users to run AWS services on-premises, providing a consistent experience with AWS public cloud services.

questions.question: A company is using a central data platform to manage multiple types of data for its customers. The company wants to use AWS services to discover, transform, and visualize the data. Which combination of AWS services should the company use to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Glue is used for discovering and transforming data, while Amazon QuickSight is used for visualizing the data. This combination meets the company's requirements for data discovery, transformation, and visualization.

questions.question: A company has deployed applications on Amazon EC2 instances. The company needs to assess application vulnerabilities and must identify infrastructure deployments that do not meet best practices. Which AWS service can the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon Inspector is a service that assesses the security vulnerabilities of applications running on EC2 instances and identifies infrastructure deployments that do not meet best practices. It provides a detailed report of the findings, allowing the company to take corrective action.

questions.question: A user wants to review all Amazon S3 buckets with ACLs and S3 bucket policies in the S3 console. Which AWS service or resource will meet this requirement?
options: AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On)
questions.explanation: Access Analyzer for S3 helps identify permissions and access to S3 buckets, including bucket policies and ACLs. It provides a detailed view of access to S3 resources, making it suitable for reviewing bucket permissions.

questions.question: A company has been storing monthly reports in an Amazon S3 bucket. The company exports the report data into comma-separated values (.csv) files. A developer wants to write a simple query that can read all of these files and generate a summary report. Which AWS service or feature should the developer use to meet these requirements with the LEAST amount of operational overhead?
questions.explanation: Amazon Athena is a serverless query engine that allows developers to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL. It provides the least amount of operational overhead as it doesn't require provisioning or managing infrastructure.

questions.question: Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The AWS Well-Architected Framework has five pillars: Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability (High availability), Performance Efficiency, and Cost Optimization. The given answer 'Performance efficiency' is one of the correct pillars, but it is not the only correct answer.
questions.verified_answer: High availability, Performance efficiency, Cost optimization

questions.question: A company wants to receive alerts to monitor its overall operating costs for its AWS public cloud infrastructure. Which AWS offering will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows users to set custom budgets for their AWS costs and receive alerts when they exceed a certain threshold. This meets the company's requirement to monitor its overall operating costs for its AWS public cloud infrastructure.

questions.question: A company need an AWS service that provides a clear baseline of what the company runs in its on-premises data centers. The company needs the projected cost to run its on premises workloads in the AWS Cloud. What AWS service or tool will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: The Migration Evaluator provides a clear baseline of on-premises workloads and estimates the cost to run them in the AWS Cloud, meeting the company's requirements.

questions.question: A company wants to monitor its workload performance. The company wants to ensure that the cloud services are delivered at a level that meets its business needs. Which AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) perspective will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: The Operations perspective of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework focuses on the day-to-day management and operation of cloud services, ensuring they meet business needs and are delivered at the required level of performance. This perspective aligns with the company's goal of monitoring workload performance and ensuring cloud services meet its business needs.

questions.question: Which actions are best practices for an AWS account root user? (Choose two.)
options: Share root user credentials with team members.
Create multiple root users for the account, separated by environment.
Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) on the root user.
Create an IAM user with administrator privileges for daily administrative tasks, instead of
answer: Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) on the root user.
Create an IAM user with administrator privileges for daily administrative tasks, instead of
questions.explanation: Sharing root user credentials with team members is a security risk. Enabling MFA on the root user and creating an IAM user for daily tasks are best practices to secure the account.
questions.verified_answer: Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) on the root user., Create an IAM user with administrator privileges for daily administrative tasks, instead of

questions.question: Which option is an environment that consists of one or more data centers?
questions.explanation: An Availability Zone is a geographic location within a Region that consists of one or more data centers. AWS Outposts is the correct answer as it is an environment that consists of one or more data centers, either on-premises or in a colocation facility.

questions.question: A company has an application with robust hardware requirements. The application must be accessed by students who are using lightweight, low-cost laptops. Which AWS service will help the company deploy the application without investing in backend infrastructure or high-end client hardware?
questions.explanation: Amazon AppStream 2.0 allows companies to stream their applications to any device, eliminating the need for high-end client hardware. This service is ideal for applications with robust hardware requirements that need to be accessed by users with lightweight laptops.

questions.question: A company has a compute workload that is steady, predictable, and uninterruptible. Which Amazon EC2 instance purchasing options meet these requirements MOST cost effectively? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances and Saving Plans are the most cost-effective options for a steady, predictable, and uninterruptible workload. This is because they provide a discounted rate for a committed usage period, making them suitable for workloads with consistent usage patterns.

questions.question: A company needs to perform data processing once a week that typically takes about 5 hours to complete. Which AWS service should the company use for this workload?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that can handle workloads that take less than 15 minutes to complete. For a workload that takes 5 hours, a serverless service like AWS Lambda is not suitable, but it's still a better choice than Amazon EC2 for this type of workload due to its cost-effectiveness and scalability.

questions.question: A company is planning its migration to the AWS Cloud. The company is identifying its capability gaps by using the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) perspectives. Which phase of the cloud transformation journey includes these identification activities?
questions.explanation: The Align phase of the cloud transformation journey involves identifying capability gaps and aligning the organization's strategy, culture, and processes with the cloud. This phase is where the company would use the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) perspectives to identify its capability gaps.

questions.question: A company launched an Amazon EC2 instance with the latest Amazon Linux 2 Amazon Machine Image (AMI). Which actions can a system administrator take to connect to the EC2 instance? (Choose two.)
options: Use a Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) connection.
Use AWS Systems Manager Session Manager.
answer: Use AWS Systems Manager Session Manager.
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 Instance Connect allows users to connect to their EC2 instances using SSH without having to manage SSH keys. AWS Systems Manager Session Manager provides secure, interactive access to EC2 instances and on-premises servers without the need to open inbound ports on the instance or the network.
questions.verified_answer: Use Amazon EC2 Instance Connect. Use AWS Systems Manager Session Manager.

questions.question: Which options are AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) cloud transformation journey recommendations? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The Envision phase is the first phase of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) cloud transformation journey, where the organization defines its cloud vision and goals. The Align phase is the second phase, where the organization aligns its business and technology strategies with its cloud vision.

questions.question: Which options are AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) security perspective capabilities? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) security perspective capabilities include incident response and infrastructure protection. These capabilities are part of the security perspective in the AWS CAF, which helps organizations design and implement secure cloud environments.

questions.question: Which of the following are features of network ACLs as they are used in the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
options: They evaluate all rules before allowing traffic.
They process rules in order, starting with the lowest numbered rule, when deciding
answer: They process rules in order, starting with the lowest numbered rule, when deciding
questions.explanation: Network ACLs in AWS are indeed stateless, meaning they do not track the state of a connection. They process rules in order, starting with the lowest numbered rule, which is a key characteristic of Network ACLs.
questions.verified_answer: They are stateless. They process rules in order, starting with the lowest numbered rule, when deciding

questions.question: Which task can a company perform by using security groups in the AWS Cloud?
options: Allow access to an Amazon EC2 instance through only a specific port.
Deny access to malicious IP addresses at a subnet level.
Protect data that is cached by Amazon CloudFront.
Apply a stateless firewall to an Amazon EC2 instance.
questions.answer: Allow access to an Amazon EC2 instance through only a specific port.
questions.explanation: Security groups in AWS can be used to control inbound and outbound traffic to and from instances. By specifying a specific port, a company can allow access to an Amazon EC2 instance through only that port, enhancing security and reducing the attack surface.
questions.verified_answer: Allow access to an Amazon EC2 instance through only a specific port.

questions.question: An external auditor has requested that a company provide a list of all its IAM users, including the status of users’ credentials and access keys. What is the SIMPLEST way to provide this information?
options: Create an IAM user account for the auditor, granting the auditor administrator permissions.
Take a screenshot of each user’s page in the AWS Management Console, then provide the screenshots to the auditor.
Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.
Download the AWS Trusted Advisor report, then provide the report to the auditor.
questions.answer: Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.
questions.explanation: The IAM credential report is a simple and efficient way to provide the requested information, as it contains a list of all IAM users, their status, and access keys. This report can be easily downloaded and shared with the auditor.
questions.verified_answer: Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows users to download security and compliance reports about the AWS infrastructure on demand?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to compliance reports, such as SOC, ISO, and PCI-DSS, as well as other security and compliance documents. This allows users to download and review these reports about the AWS infrastructure as needed.

questions.question: A company uses Amazon S3 to store records that can contain personally identifiable information (PII). The company wants a solution that can monitor all S3 buckets for PII and immediately alert staff about vulnerabilities. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon Macie is designed to discover and classify sensitive data, such as personally identifiable information (PII), stored in Amazon S3. It can monitor S3 buckets for PII and alert staff about vulnerabilities, meeting the company's requirements.

questions.question: A company wants to run its workloads in the AWS Cloud effectively, reduce management overhead, and improve processes. Which AWS Well-Architected Framework pillar represents these requirements?
questions.explanation: The Operational excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework focuses on running and managing AWS workloads to achieve high levels of operational efficiency, effectiveness, and reliability. It helps reduce management overhead and improve processes, aligning with the company's requirements.

questions.question: A company is using the AWS Free Tier for several AWS services for an application. What will happen if the Free Tier usage period expires or if the application use exceeds the Free Tier usage limits?
options: The company will be charged the standard pay-as-you-go service rates for the usage that exceeds the Free Tier usage.
AWS Support will contact the company to set up standard service charges.
The company will be charged for the services it consumed during the Free Tier period, plus additional charges for service consumption after the Free Tier period.
The company’s AWS account will be frozen and can be restarted after a payment plan is established.
questions.answer: The company will be charged the standard pay-as-you-go service rates for the usage that exceeds the Free Tier usage.
questions.explanation: When the Free Tier usage period expires or the application use exceeds the Free Tier usage limits, the company will be charged for the additional usage at the standard pay-as-you-go rates. This is because the Free Tier is a promotional offer that provides a limited amount of usage for free, and any usage beyond that is billed at the standard rates.
questions.verified_answer: The company will be charged the standard pay-as-you-go service rates for the usage that exceeds the Free Tier usage.

questions.question: Which option is a shared control between AWS and the customer, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, configuration management is a shared responsibility between AWS and the customer. This means that AWS is responsible for the underlying infrastructure, while the customer is responsible for configuring and managing their resources.

questions.question: A company that uses AWS needs to transfer 2 TB of data. Which type of transfer of that data would result in no cost for the company?
options: Inbound data transfer from the internet
Outbound data transfer to the internet
questions.answer: Inbound data transfer from the internet
questions.explanation: Inbound data transfer from the internet is free for AWS resources, such as EC2 instances. This means that data transferred to an AWS resource from the internet does not incur any additional costs.
questions.verified_answer: Inbound data transfer from the internet

questions.question: A social media company wants to protect its web application from common web exploits such as SQL injections and cross-site scripting. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) is designed to protect web applications from common web exploits such as SQL injections and cross-site scripting by filtering HTTP traffic. It can be integrated with AWS resources such as Amazon CloudFront, Elastic Load Balancer, and API Gateway.

questions.question: Which of the following describes some of the core functionality of Amazon S3?
options: Amazon S3 is a high-performance block storage service that is designed for use with Amazon EC2.
Amazon S3 is an object storage service that provides high-level performance, security, scalability, and data availability.
Amazon S3 is a fully managed, highly reliable, and scalable file storage system that is accessible over the industry-standard SMB protocol.
Amazon S3 is a scalable, fully managed elastic NFS for use with AWS Cloud services and on-premises resources.
questions.answer: Amazon S3 is an object storage service that provides high-level performance, security, scalability, and data availability.
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is indeed an object storage service that provides high-level performance, security, scalability, and data availability. This is a core functionality of Amazon S3, making the given answer correct.
