questions.explanation: Core checks are available to all AWS users and provide general best practices for security, performance, and cost optimization. They are a subset of the full set of Trusted Advisor checks, which may require additional permissions or support plans to access.

questions.question: A user has limited knowledge of AWS services, but wants to quickly deploy a scalable Node.js application in the AWS Cloud. Which service should be used to deploy the application?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk is a service that allows users to quickly deploy web applications and services without worrying about the underlying infrastructure. It supports a variety of platforms, including Node.js, and provides features such as auto-scaling and load balancing.

questions.question: Which tool can be used to create alerts when the actual or forecasted cost of AWS services exceeds a certain threshold?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows users to set custom budgets and receive alerts when actual or forecasted costs exceed the set threshold. This helps users stay on top of their AWS expenses and make informed decisions about their resource usage.

questions.question: AnyCompany recently purchased Example Corp. Both companies use AWS resources, and AnyCompany wants a single aggregated bill. Which option allows AnyCompany to receive a single bill?
options: Example Corp. must submit a request to its AWS solutions architect or AWS technical account manager to link the accounts and consolidate billing.
AnyCompany must create a new support case in the AWS Support Center requesting that both bills be combined.
Send an invitation to join the organization from AnyCompany’s AWS Organizations master account to Example Corp.
Migrate the Example Corp. VPCs, Amazon EC2 instances, and other resources into the AnyCompany AWS account.
questions.answer: Send an invitation to join the organization from AnyCompany’s AWS Organizations master account to Example Corp.
questions.explanation: To receive a single aggregated bill, AnyCompany needs to consolidate the accounts of both companies under a single AWS Organizations master account. This can be achieved by sending an invitation to join the organization from the master account to Example Corp.
questions.verified_answer: Send an invitation to join the organization from AnyCompany’s AWS Organizations master account to Example Corp.

questions.question: A company is building an application that requires the ability to send, store, and receive messages between application components. The company has another requirement to process messages in first-in, first-out (FIFO) order. Which AWS service should the company use?
questions.explanation: Amazon SQS is a fully managed message queuing service that supports FIFO (First-In-First-Out) queues, making it suitable for applications that require messages to be processed in the order they were received.

questions.question: Which AWS services offer compute capabilities? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 provides virtual servers for compute tasks, while AWS Lambda offers serverless compute capabilities for event-driven applications.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature requires an internet service provider (ISP) and a colocation facility to be implemented?
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect is a service that allows for a dedicated network connection from an on-premises network to AWS. This connection requires a colocation facility and an internet service provider (ISP) to be implemented.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows customers to purchase unused Amazon EC2 capacity at an often discounted rate?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances allow customers to purchase unused Amazon EC2 capacity at an often discounted rate, providing a cost-effective option for non-critical or flexible workloads. This service is ideal for applications that can be interrupted or scaled back when needed.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides the ability to host a NoSQL database in the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast, fully managed item storage and retrieval. It is designed to handle large amounts of data and scale as needed.

questions.question: A company wants to be notified when its AWS Cloud costs or usage exceed defined thresholds. Which AWS service will support these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows users to set custom budgets and receive notifications when costs or usage exceed defined thresholds. This service is specifically designed for cost and usage monitoring and alerting.

questions.question: What is the customer’s responsibility when using AWS Lambda?
questions.explanation: When using AWS Lambda, the customer is responsible for managing their application, including writing and testing the code, as well as managing dependencies and libraries. This is because AWS Lambda provides a managed compute service, but the customer is still responsible for the application itself.

questions.question: Which of the following is the customer’s responsibility when using Amazon RDS?
options: Patching the operating system of underlying hardware
Controlling traffic to and from the database through security groups
Running backups that enable point-in-time recovery of a DB instance
questions.answer: Controlling traffic to and from the database through security groups
questions.explanation: The customer is responsible for controlling traffic to and from the database through security groups, which is a key aspect of database security. This includes configuring security groups to allow or deny access to the database instance.
questions.verified_answer: Controlling traffic to and from the database through security groups

questions.question: Which tool can be used to identify scheduled changes to the AWS infrastructure?
questions.explanation: AWS Config is a service that provides a detailed inventory of the AWS resources and related configurations. It also tracks changes made to these resources over time, allowing you to identify scheduled changes to the AWS infrastructure.

questions.question: A workload on AWS will run for the foreseeable future by using a consistent number of Amazon EC2 instances. What pricing model will minimize cost while ensuring that compute resources remain available?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide a significant discount compared to On-Demand Instances, making them a cost-effective option for workloads with a consistent number of instances. This pricing model also ensures that compute resources remain available, as reserved instances are guaranteed to be available for the term of the reservation.

questions.question: What are the advantages of deploying an application with Amazon EC2 instances in multiple Availability Zones? (Choose two.)
options: Preventing a single point of failure
Reducing the operational costs of the application
Allowing the application to serve cross-region users with low latency
Increasing the availability of the application
Increasing the load of the application
answer: Preventing a single point of failure
Increasing the availability of the application
questions.explanation: Deploying an application with Amazon EC2 instances in multiple Availability Zones helps prevent a single point of failure by ensuring that if one Availability Zone becomes unavailable, the application can still function in other Availability Zones. This also increases the availability of the application, as it can continue to operate even if one Availability Zone experiences issues.
questions.verified_answer: Preventing a single point of failure, Increasing the availability of the application

questions.question: A company is running a self-managed Oracle database directly on Amazon EC2 for its steady-state database. The company wants to reduce compute costs. Which option should the company use to maximize savings over a 3-year term?
questions.explanation: EC2 Reserved Instances provide a significant discount compared to On-Demand Instances, making them a cost-effective option for steady-state workloads like databases. By committing to a 3-year term, the company can maximize savings on their compute costs.

questions.question: How should a web application be deployed to ensure high availability in the AWS Cloud?
options: Deploy multiple instances of the application in multiple Availability Zones.
Deploy multiple instances of the application in a single Availability Zone.
Deploy the application to a compute-optimized Amazon EC2 instance in a single Availability Zone.
Deploy the application in one Amazon EC2 instance in an Auto Scaling group.
questions.answer: Deploy multiple instances of the application in multiple Availability Zones.
questions.explanation: Deploying multiple instances of the application in multiple Availability Zones ensures high availability by providing redundancy and fault tolerance. This approach allows the application to continue running even if one Availability Zone experiences an outage.
questions.verified_answer: Deploy multiple instances of the application in multiple Availability Zones.

questions.question: A company has an AWS-hosted website located behind an Application Load Balancer. The company wants to safeguard the website from SQL injection or cross- site scripting. Which AWS service should the company use?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) is a service that helps protect web applications from common web exploits and SQL injection or cross-site scripting attacks. It can be integrated with an Application Load Balancer to filter incoming traffic.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to retrieve compliance reports on demand?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to compliance reports and attestations for AWS services and business processes. It allows users to view and download compliance reports, such as SOC 1 and SOC 2 reports, and other compliance-related documents.

questions.question: A company wants to connect to AWS over a private, low-latency connection from its remote office. What is the recommended method to meet these requirements?
options: Use VPC peering to create a connection.
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated network connection from a company's premises to AWS, offering low latency and high bandwidth. This is ideal for remote offices that require a private and high-speed connection to AWS resources.

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud design principles can help increase reliability? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Testing recovery procedures' because it helps identify potential issues before they occur, and 'Automatically recovering from failure' because it ensures minimal downtime in case of failures. These principles are key to increasing reliability in AWS cloud design.
questions.verified_answer: Testing recovery procedures, Automatically recovering from failure

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature is used to send both text and email messages from distributed applications?
questions.explanation: Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) is used to send messages to distributed applications, including both text and email messages. It supports multiple protocols and endpoints, making it a versatile choice for notification needs.

questions.question: A company wants to ensure its infrastructure is designed for fault tolerance and business continuity in the event of an environmental disruption. Which AWS infrastructure component should the company replicate across?
questions.explanation: Replicating Availability Zones (AZs) across different regions provides fault tolerance and business continuity in the event of an environmental disruption. This is because AZs are isolated from each other within a region, reducing the risk of a single point of failure.

questions.question: Which AWS service should a cloud practitioner use to identify security vulnerabilities of an AWS account?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor is a service that provides best practices checks for security, performance, and cost optimization. It helps identify security vulnerabilities and provides recommendations to improve the security posture of an AWS account.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to privately store and manage versions of source code?
questions.explanation: AWS CodeCommit is a source control service that allows you to privately store and manage versions of your source code. It provides a secure and scalable repository for your code, making it the correct answer among the given options.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature can be used to prevent SQL injection attacks?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) can be used to prevent SQL injection attacks by filtering and blocking malicious traffic. It provides a set of rules to identify and mitigate common web exploits, including SQL injection attacks.

questions.question: 31. How can AWS enable a company to control expenses as an application’s usage changes unpredictably?
options: AWS will refund the cost difference if a customer moves to larger servers.
The application can be built to scale up or down automatically as resources are needed
Spot instances will automatically be used if the price is lower than on-demand instances.
Amazon CloudWatch will automatically predict what resources are needed.
questions.answer: The application can be built to scale up or down automatically as resources are needed
questions.explanation: This is achieved through AWS Auto Scaling, which allows resources to automatically scale up or down based on predefined rules, such as CPU utilization or custom metrics. This helps companies control expenses by only paying for the resources they need at any given time.
questions.verified_answer: The application can be built to scale up or down automatically as resources are needed

questions.question: A pharmaceutical company operates its infrastructure in a single AWS Region. The company has thousands of VPCs in a various AWS accounts that it wants to interconnect. Which AWS service or feature should the company use to help simplify management and reduce operational costs?
questions.explanation: AWS Transit Gateway is a network service that makes it easier to connect multiple VPCs in different AWS accounts and Regions, simplifying management and reducing operational costs. It acts as a hub that allows traffic to flow between VPCs, eliminating the need for VPC peering connections or VPN connections.

questions.question: Which cloud computing benefit does AWS demonstrate with its ability to offer lower variable costs as a result of high purchase volumes?
questions.explanation: AWS demonstrates economies of scale by offering lower variable costs due to high purchase volumes, which translates to pay-as-you-go pricing. This allows customers to only pay for the resources they use, reducing costs.

questions.question: The AWS IAM best practice for granting least privilege is to:
options: apply an IAM policy to an IAM group and limit the size of the group.
require multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all IAM users.
require each IAM user who has different permissions to have multiple passwords.
apply an IAM policy only to IAM users who require it.
questions.answer: apply an IAM policy only to IAM users who require it.
questions.explanation: This best practice ensures that IAM users are granted only the permissions they need to perform their job functions, reducing the risk of privilege escalation. By applying IAM policies directly to users, you can fine-tune access controls and minimize unnecessary permissions.
questions.verified_answer: apply an IAM policy only to IAM users who require it.

questions.question: A company is building an application that needs to deliver images and videos globally with minimal latency. Which approach can the company use to accomplish this in a cost effective manner?
options: Deliver the content through Amazon CloudFront.
Store the content on Amazon S3 and enable S3 cross-region replication.
Implement a VPN across multiple AWS Regions.
Deliver the content through AWS PrivateLink.
questions.answer: Deliver the content through Amazon CloudFront.
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) that can cache and distribute content globally, reducing latency and improving performance. It is a cost-effective solution for delivering images and videos to a global audience.
questions.verified_answer: Deliver the content through Amazon CloudFront.

questions.question: A company wants to track AWS resource configuration changes for compliance reasons. Which AWS feature can be used to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS Config rules can be used to track AWS resource configuration changes by evaluating the configuration of AWS resources against desired configurations. This helps meet compliance requirements by providing a record of changes made to AWS resources.

questions.question: A company is expecting a short-term spike in internet traffic for its application. During the traffic increase, the application cannot be interrupted. The company also needs to minimize cost and maximize flexibility. Which Amazon EC2 instance type should the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances provide the flexibility to scale up or down as needed, without long-term commitments, making them suitable for short-term spikes in traffic. They also allow for interruption-free operation, as they can be terminated and restarted without data loss.

questions.question: What are the benefits of consolidated billing for AWS Cloud services? (Choose two.)
options: A minimal additional fee for use
Custom cost and usage budget creation
questions.explanation: Consolidated billing allows for a single bill to be generated for multiple AWS accounts, making it easier to manage costs. Additionally, it provides volume discounts for eligible services, reducing the overall cost of using AWS.

questions.question: An external auditor has requested that a company provide a list of all its IAM users, including the status of users’ credentials and access keys. What it the SIMPLEST way to provide this information?
options: Create an IAM user account for the auditor, granting the auditor administrator permissions.
Take a screenshot of each user’s page in the AWS Management Console, then provide the screenshots to the auditor.
Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.
Download the AWS Trusted Advisor report, then provide the report to the auditor.
questions.answer: Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.
questions.explanation: The IAM credential report is a simple and efficient way to provide the requested information, as it contains a list of all IAM users, their status, and access keys. This report can be easily downloaded and shared with the auditor.
questions.verified_answer: Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.

questions.question: A company wants to transfer petabytes of data as quickly as possible from on-premises locations to the AWS Cloud. Which AWS service should the company use?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball is a petabyte-scale data transfer service that allows for the transfer of large amounts of data to the AWS Cloud as quickly as possible. It is particularly useful for transferring data from on-premises locations to the cloud.

questions.question: Which of the following services can be used to block network traffic to an instance? (Choose two.)
options: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) flow logs
questions.explanation: Security groups and Network ACLs are used to control incoming and outgoing traffic to and from instances in a VPC. They can be used to block network traffic to an instance by denying access to specific ports or IP addresses.

questions.question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following are AWS responsibilities? (Choose two.)
options: Network infrastructure and virtualization of infrastructure
answer: Network infrastructure and virtualization of infrastructure
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for the physical security of hardware and the network infrastructure and virtualization of infrastructure. This includes the security of the data centers and the underlying infrastructure, but not the security of the data itself or the guest operating systems.
questions.verified_answer: Network infrastructure and virtualization of infrastructure, Physical security of hardware

questions.question: A company needs to track the activity in its AWS accounts, and needs to know when an API call is made against its AWS resources. Which AWS tool or service can be used to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail is used to track the activity in AWS accounts, including API calls made against AWS resources. It provides a record of all AWS API calls made within an account, including the identity of the user or role that made the call.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which task is the customer’s responsibility when managing AWS Lambda functions?
options: Scaling Lambda resources according to demand
questions.explanation: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for managing their own AWS Lambda functions, including creating versions of these functions. This allows customers to track changes and roll back to previous versions if needed.

questions.question: Which AWS service automatically handles application health monitoring?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk automatically handles application health monitoring by providing features such as auto-scaling, load balancing, and health checks. This allows developers to focus on writing code rather than managing the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question: A user can increase operational efficiency in the AWS Cloud by:
questions.explanation: Leveraging AWS managed services can help increase operational efficiency by reducing the need for manual management and maintenance of resources. This allows users to focus on higher-level tasks and scale their applications more easily.

questions.question: According to security best practices, how should an Amazon EC2 instance be given access to an Amazon S3 bucket?
options: Hard code an IAM user's secret key and access key directly in the application, and upload the file.
Store the IAM user's secret key and access key in a text file on the EC2 instance, read the keys, then upload the file.
Have the EC2 instance assume a role to obtain the privileges to upload the file.
Modify the S3 bucket policy so that any service can upload to it at any time.
questions.answer: Have the EC2 instance assume a role to obtain the privileges to upload the file.
questions.explanation: This is the most secure option as it uses AWS IAM roles to delegate permissions to the EC2 instance without exposing sensitive credentials. This approach also allows for fine-grained access control and auditing.
questions.verified_answer: Have the EC2 instance assume a role to obtain the privileges to upload the file.

questions.question: Which of the following IT tasks does AWS perform to offload a company’s IT resource management responsibilities? (Choose two.)
options: Setting up access controls for data
questions.explanation: AWS performs various tasks to offload a company's IT resource management responsibilities, including setting up access controls for data, which is a security feature provided by AWS services such as IAM and S3. Backing up databases is also a task that can be offloaded to AWS services like RDS and DynamoDB.
questions.verified_answer: Backing up databases, Setting up access controls for data

questions.question: Which AWS service can help a company detect an outage of its website servers and redirect users to alternate servers?
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable Domain Name System (DNS) service that can route traffic to alternate servers in case of an outage. It provides low-latency routing and can be used for load balancing and failover.

questions.question: Which AWS Trusted Advisor feature is available exclusively to users with AWS Business Support or AWS Enterprise Support?
questions.explanation: The AWS Support API is a feature of AWS Trusted Advisor that is available exclusively to users with AWS Business Support or AWS Enterprise Support. This API allows users to programmatically access and manage their Trusted Advisor checks and recommendations.

questions.question: The AWS global infrastructure consists of Regions, Availability Zones, and what else?
questions.explanation: The AWS global infrastructure consists of Regions, Availability Zones, and Edge locations. Edge locations are points of presence where AWS stores content for faster delivery to users.

questions.question: A media company wants to distribute video content to millions of users worldwide over the internet. The company wants to use the AWS global network backbone to distribute cached content with low latency and high data transfer speeds. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) that uses the AWS global network backbone to distribute cached content with low latency and high data transfer speeds. It is designed to handle large amounts of traffic and scale to meet the needs of a global audience.

questions.question: A bank needs to store recordings of calls made to its contact center for 6 years. The recordings must be accessible within 48 hours from the time they are requested. Which AWS service will provide a secure and cost-effective solution for retaining these files?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 Glacier is a cost-effective solution for long-term data archiving and retrieval. It provides secure and durable storage for infrequently accessed data, such as call recordings, and can retrieve data within 48 hours.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature provides information about ongoing or upcoming scheduled events that can affect an AWS account?
questions.explanation: The AWS Personal Health Dashboard provides information about ongoing or upcoming scheduled events that can affect an AWS account, helping users to plan and prepare for potential disruptions. It offers real-time visibility into AWS service health and provides personalized health events for your AWS resources.

questions.question: Which statement is true about AWS global infrastructure?
options: Availability Zones can span multiple AWS Regions.
A VPC can have different subnets in different AWS Regions.
AWS Regions consist of multiple Availability Zones.
A single subnet can span multiple Availability Zones.
questions.answer: AWS Regions consist of multiple Availability Zones.
questions.explanation: This statement is true because AWS Regions are designed to be isolated from each other, and each Region consists of multiple Availability Zones (AZs) that are isolated from each other. This allows for high availability and redundancy within a Region.
questions.verified_answer: AWS Regions consist of multiple Availability Zones.

questions.question: A company wants to securely access an Amazon S3 bucket from an Amazon EC2 instance without accessing the internet. What should the company use to accomplish this goal?
questions.explanation: A VPC endpoint allows a VPC to communicate with an S3 bucket without going over the internet. A NAT gateway is used to provide internet access to instances in a private subnet, which is not the goal in this scenario.

questions.question: Which of the following is an AWS best practice for managing an AWS account root user?
options: Keep the root user password with the security team.
Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user.
Create an access key for the root user.
Keep the root user password consistent for compliance purposes.
questions.answer: Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user.
questions.explanation: Enabling MFA for the root user adds an extra layer of security to prevent unauthorized access to the account. This is a recommended best practice by AWS to protect sensitive account information.
questions.verified_answer: Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user.

questions.question: A company hosts images in an Amazon S3 bucket for a public-facing website that is viewed by millions of users around the globe. Which AWS service will deliver this content with reduced latency?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) that can reduce latency by caching content at edge locations around the world, making it easily accessible to users with lower latency.

questions.question: A company has refined its workload to use specific AWS services to improve efficiency and reduce cost. Which best practice for cost governance does this example show?
questions.explanation: The company has refined its workload to use specific AWS services, which is an example of optimizing the architecture to improve efficiency and reduce cost. This is a key aspect of architecture optimization, which involves designing and implementing the most cost-effective and efficient architecture for the workload.

questions.question: Which service provides a user the ability to warehouse data in the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a data warehouse service that allows users to store and analyze large datasets in the AWS Cloud. It provides a scalable and secure platform for data warehousing and business intelligence.

questions.question: A user is planning to migrate an application workload to the AWS Cloud. Which control becomes the responsibility of AWS once the migration is complete?
options: Protecting communications and maintaining zone security
questions.explanation: Once a workload is migrated to the cloud, AWS is responsible for maintaining the physical and environmental controls, such as the data center and power infrastructure. This is a key aspect of the shared responsibility model in AWS, where AWS is responsible for the underlying infrastructure and the customer is responsible for the application and data.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to provide an on-demand, cloud-based contact center?
questions.explanation: Amazon Connect is a cloud-based contact center service that allows businesses to manage customer interactions and provide on-demand support. It offers features such as call routing, IVR, and real-time analytics.

questions.question: What tool enables customers without an AWS account to estimate costs for almost all AWS services?
questions.explanation: The TCO Calculator is a tool provided by AWS that allows customers to estimate costs for almost all AWS services, even without an AWS account. This makes it an ideal choice for customers who want to plan their costs before signing up for an AWS account.

questions.question: Which component must be attached to a VPC to enable inbound Internet access?
questions.explanation: An Internet gateway is required to enable inbound and outbound Internet access to and from a VPC. It acts as a router that connects a VPC to the Internet.

questions.question: Which pricing model would result in maximum Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) savings for a database server that must be online for one year?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide the maximum savings for Amazon EC2, with discounts of up to 75% compared to On-Demand Instances. A Partial Upfront Reserved Instance is the best option for a database server that must be online for one year, as it provides a balance between upfront costs and long-term savings.

questions.question: A company has a MySQL database running on a single Amazon EC2 instance. The company now requires higher availability in the event of an outage. Which set of tasks would meet this requirement?
options: Add an Application Load Balancer in front of the EC2 instance
Configure EC2 Auto Recovery to move the instance to another Availability Zone
Migrate to Amazon RDS and enable Multi-AZ
Enable termination protection for the EC2 instance to avoid outages
questions.answer: Migrate to Amazon RDS and enable Multi-AZ
questions.explanation: Migrating to Amazon RDS and enabling Multi-AZ provides higher availability by automatically replicating the database to a standby instance in a different Availability Zone, ensuring minimal downtime in case of an outage. This approach also eliminates the need for manual database backups and restores.
questions.verified_answer: Migrate to Amazon RDS and enable Multi-AZ

questions.question: A company wants to ensure that AWS Management Console users are meeting password complexity requirements. How can the company configure password complexity?
options: Using an AWS IAM user policy
Using an AWS Organizations service control policy (SCP)
Using an AWS IAM account password policy
Using an AWS Security Hub managed insight
questions.answer: Using an AWS IAM account password policy
questions.explanation: AWS IAM account password policy allows administrators to enforce password complexity requirements for AWS Management Console users. This includes setting requirements such as minimum password length, character types, and password rotation.
questions.verified_answer: Using an AWS IAM account password policy

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following is the customer’s responsibility?
options: Patching and fixing flaws in the infrastructure
questions.explanation: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for patching and maintaining their guest operating system and applications, as well as any data they store in AWS. This includes ensuring that their OS and applications are up-to-date with the latest security patches.

questions.question: Which of the following tasks is required to deploy a PCI-compliant workload on AWS?
options: Use any AWS service and implement PCI controls at the application layer
Use an AWS service that is in-scope for PCI compliance and raise an AWS support ticket to enable PCI compliance at the application layer
Use any AWS service and raise an AWS support ticket to enable PCI compliance on that service
Use an AWS service that is in scope for PCI compliance and apply PCI controls at the application layer
questions.answer: Use an AWS service that is in scope for PCI compliance and apply PCI controls at the application layer
questions.explanation: To deploy a PCI-compliant workload on AWS, it's essential to use an AWS service that is in-scope for PCI compliance. This ensures that the service itself meets the necessary security standards, and then applying PCI controls at the application layer completes the compliance requirements.
questions.verified_answer: Use an AWS service that is in scope for PCI compliance and apply PCI controls at the application layer

questions.question: Which are benefits of using Amazon RDS over Amazon EC2 when running relational databases on AWS? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS provides automated backups, software patching, and other database management features, making it a more convenient option for running relational databases on AWS compared to Amazon EC2. This allows users to focus on their application rather than managing the underlying database infrastructure.

questions.question: What does the Amazon S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class offer?
options: Payment flexibility by reserving storage capacity
Long-term retention of data by copying the data to an encrypted Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume
Automatic cost savings by moving objects between tiers based on access pattern changes
Secure, durable, and lowest cost storage for data archival
questions.answer: Automatic cost savings by moving objects between tiers based on access pattern changes
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 Intelligent-Tiering is a storage class that automatically moves objects between different storage tiers based on access patterns, providing cost savings. This feature allows for dynamic storage tiering without manual intervention.
questions.verified_answer: Automatic cost savings by moving objects between tiers based on access pattern changes

questions.question: A company has multiple data sources across the organization and wants to consolidate data into one data warehouse. Which AWS service can be used to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fully managed data warehouse service that allows users to consolidate data from multiple sources into one location for analysis. It supports columnar storage and is optimized for querying large datasets.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to track resource changes and establish compliance?
questions.explanation: AWS Config is the correct answer because it is a service that enables resource inventory, configuration history, and configuration rules to track resource changes and establish compliance. It provides a detailed view of the configuration of AWS resources and helps in evaluating the overall compliance of the resources.

questions.question: A user has underutilized on-premises resources. Which AWS Cloud concept can BEST address this issue?
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows users to scale their resources up or down based on demand, making it ideal for addressing underutilized on-premises resources. This concept enables users to pay only for the resources they use, reducing waste and costs.

questions.question: A user has a stateful workload that will run on Amazon EC2 for the next 3 years. What is the MOST cost-effective pricing model for this workload?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide a significant discount compared to On-Demand Instances, making them the most cost-effective option for long-term workloads. This is because Reserved Instances require a upfront payment and a one-year or three-year commitment.

questions.question: A cloud practitioner needs an Amazon EC2 instance to launch and run for 7 hours without interruptions. What is the most suitable and cost-effective option for this task?
questions.explanation: An On-Demand Instance is the most suitable and cost-effective option for this task because it allows the practitioner to pay for the instance only for the time it is running, without any upfront costs or long-term commitments. This flexibility makes it ideal for short-term or variable workloads like the 7-hour instance described.

questions.question: Which of the following are benefits of using AWS Trusted Advisor? (Choose two.)
options: Detecting underutilized resources to save costs
Improving security by proactively monitoring the AWS environment
Implementing enforced tagging across AWS resources
answer: Detecting underutilized resources to save costs
Improving security by proactively monitoring the AWS environment
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides best practices checks for cost optimization, security, performance, and more. It helps detect underutilized resources to save costs and improves security by proactively monitoring the AWS environment.
questions.verified_answer: Detecting underutilized resources to save costs, Improving security by proactively monitoring the AWS environment

questions.question: A developer has been hired by a large company and needs AWS credentials. Which are security best practices that should be followed? (Choose two.)
options: Grant the developer access to only the AWS resources needed to perform the job.
Share the AWS account root user credentials with the developer.
Add the developer to the administrator’s group in AWS IAM.
Configure a password policy that ensures the developer’s password cannot be changed.
Ensure the account password policy requires a minimum length.
answer: Grant the developer access to only the AWS resources needed to perform the job.
Ensure the account password policy requires a minimum length.
questions.explanation: This is a security best practice as it minimizes the attack surface and prevents unauthorized access to sensitive resources. It also aligns with the principle of least privilege.
questions.verified_answer: Grant the developer access to only the AWS resources needed to perform the job.

questions.question: Which AWS storage service is designed to transfer petabytes of data in and out of the cloud?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball is a service designed to transfer large amounts of data in and out of the cloud, making it ideal for petabyte-scale data transfers. It uses physical appliances to transfer data, which can be more efficient than using the internet for large data transfers.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows for effective cost management of multiple AWS accounts?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows for effective cost management of multiple AWS accounts by providing a centralized platform to manage and track costs across accounts. It also enables features such as cost allocation tags and consolidated billing.

questions.question: A company is piloting a new customer-facing application on Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) for one month. What pricing model is appropriate?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances provide flexible pricing, allowing the company to pay for the EC2 instances only for the time they are running, which is suitable for a short-term pilot. This pricing model does not require a long-term commitment, making it ideal for a one-month pilot.

questions.question: Which AWS tools automatically forecast future AWS costs?
options: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator
questions.explanation: Cost Explorer is an AWS tool that provides detailed cost and usage analytics, allowing users to forecast future AWS costs. It offers features such as cost forecasting, budgeting, and cost allocation.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following is a responsibility of AWS?
options: Enabling server-side encryption for objects stored in S3
Patching the operating system on an Amazon EC2 instance
questions.explanation: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for the underlying infrastructure, including the hypervisor. This means that AWS is responsible for applying updates to the hypervisor, ensuring the security and reliability of the underlying environment.

questions.question: A user is able to set up a master payer account to view consolidated billing reports through:
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows users to create a master payer account, which enables consolidated billing and reporting across multiple AWS accounts. This feature is specifically designed for managing and tracking costs across multiple accounts.

questions.question: Performing operations as code is a design principle that supports which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
questions.explanation: Performing operations as code is a key principle of operational excellence, as it enables automation, consistency, and repeatability in the management of AWS resources. This approach helps to reduce errors, improve efficiency, and increase the overall reliability of the system.

questions.question: Which design principle is achieved by following the reliability pillar of the AWS Well Architected Framework?
questions.explanation: The reliability pillar of the AWS Well Architected Framework focuses on designing systems that are highly available and can recover from failures. Testing recovery procedures is a key principle in achieving this goal by ensuring that systems can recover from failures and maintain high availability.

questions.question: What is a characteristic of Convertible Reserved Instances (RIs)?
options: Users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs from a different instance family.
Users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs in different AWS Regions.
Users can sell and buy Convertible RIs on the AWS Marketplace.
Users can shorten the term of their Convertible RIs by merging them with other Convertible RIs.
questions.answer: Users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs from a different instance family.
questions.explanation: Convertible Reserved Instances (RIs) allow users to exchange them for other Convertible RIs from a different instance family, providing flexibility in instance type selection. This feature is particularly useful when instance type requirements change over time.
questions.verified_answer: Users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs from a different instance family.

questions.question: The user is fully responsible for which action when running workloads on AWS?
options: Implementing controls to route application traffic
questions.answer: Implementing controls to route application traffic
questions.explanation: When running workloads on AWS, the user is fully responsible for maintaining the underlying infrastructure components, such as patching and updating their own EC2 instances, RDS databases, and other resources. This is because AWS provides a shared responsibility model, where AWS is responsible for the underlying infrastructure, but the user is responsible for the resources they deploy on top of it.

questions.question: An architecture design includes Amazon EC2, an Elastic Load Balancer, and Amazon RDS. What is the BEST way to get a monthly cost estimation for this architecture?
options: Open an AWS Support case, provide the architecture proposal, and ask for a monthly cost estimation.
Collect the published prices of the AWS services and calculate the monthly estimate.
Use the AWS Simple Monthly Calculator to estimate the monthly cost.
Use the AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator to estimate the monthly cost.
questions.answer: Use the AWS Simple Monthly Calculator to estimate the monthly cost.
questions.explanation: The AWS Simple Monthly Calculator is a tool provided by AWS to help estimate the monthly costs of AWS services. It takes into account the usage and pricing of various services, making it the most accurate and efficient way to get a monthly cost estimation for the given architecture.
questions.verified_answer: Use the AWS Simple Monthly Calculator to estimate the monthly cost.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows users to download security and compliance reports about the AWS infrastructure on demand?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to security and compliance reports about the AWS infrastructure, as well as compliance and security documents from AWS and its partners. This allows users to easily access and download the necessary information for their compliance and security needs.

questions.question: Which AWS managed services can be used to extend an on-premises data center to the AWS network? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect is a service that makes it possible to establish a dedicated network connection from an on-premises data center to AWS. However, Amazon Route 53 is a DNS service and does not extend an on-premises data center to the AWS network.

questions.question: Which requirement must be met for a member account to be unlinked from an AWS Organizations account?
options: The linked account must be actively compliant with AWS System and Organization Controls (SOC).
The payer and the linked account must both create AWS Support cases to request that the member account be unlinked from the organization.
The member account must meet the requirements of a standalone account.
The payer account must be used to remove the linked account from the organization.
questions.answer: The member account must meet the requirements of a standalone account.
questions.explanation: To unlink a member account from an AWS Organizations account, the member account must be able to function independently, meeting the requirements of a standalone account. This includes having its own AWS Support case and being able to manage its own resources.
questions.verified_answer: The member account must meet the requirements of a standalone account.

questions.question: What AWS benefit refers to a customer’s ability to deploy applications that scale up and down the meet variable demand?
questions.explanation: Elasticity in AWS refers to the ability to quickly scale up or down to meet changing demands, allowing for efficient use of resources. This is a key benefit of cloud computing, enabling customers to adapt to variable workloads and optimize costs.

questions.question: During a compliance review, one of the auditors requires a copy of the AWS SOC 2 report. Which service should be used to submit this request?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact is a service that provides on-demand access to compliance reports, including the AWS SOC 2 report. It allows users to search, view, and download compliance reports, making it the correct service to submit a request for the AWS SOC 2 report.

questions.question: A company wants to set up a highly available workload in AWS with a disaster recovery plan that will allow the company to recover in case of a regional service interruption. Which configuration will meet these requirements?
options: Run on two Availability Zones in one AWS Region, using the additional Availability Zones in the AWS Region for the disaster recovery site.
Run on two Availability Zones in one AWS Region, using another AWS Region for the disaster recovery site.
Run on two Availability Zones in one AWS Region, using a local AWS Region for the disaster recovery site.
Run across two AWS Regions, using a third AWS Region for the disaster recovery site.
questions.answer: Run on two Availability Zones in one AWS Region, using another AWS Region for the disaster recovery site.
questions.explanation: This configuration meets the requirements because it ensures high availability within one region and provides a disaster recovery site in another region, allowing for recovery in case of a regional service interruption. This approach also reduces the cost and complexity associated with setting up a disaster recovery site in a third region.
questions.verified_answer: Run on two Availability Zones in one AWS Region, using another AWS Region for the disaster recovery site.

questions.question: A company has a 500 TB image repository that needs to be transported to AWS for processing. Which AWS service can import this data MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball is a petabyte-scale data transfer service that can import large amounts of data to AWS in a cost-effective and secure manner. It is ideal for transferring large datasets like the 500 TB image repository mentioned in the question.

questions.question: Which AWS service can run a managed PostgreSQL database that provides online transaction processing (OLTP)?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS provides a managed relational database service that supports various database engines, including PostgreSQL. It is well-suited for online transaction processing (OLTP) workloads due to its high performance, reliability, and scalability features.

questions.question: Which of the following assist in identifying costs by department? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Using tags on resources allows you to categorize and track costs by department by assigning specific tags to resources. Using multiple AWS accounts also helps in identifying costs by department by isolating costs for each department in separate accounts.

questions.question: A company must store critical business data in Amazon S3 with a backup to another AWS Region. How can this be achieved?
options: Use an Amazon CloudFront Content Delivery Network (CDN) to cache data globally
Set up Amazon S3 cross-region replication to another AWS Region
Configure the AWS Backup service to back up to the data to another AWS Region
Take Amazon S3 bucket snapshots and copy that data to another AWS Region
questions.answer: Set up Amazon S3 cross-region replication to another AWS Region
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 cross-region replication allows automatic and asynchronous replication of objects from one AWS Region to another, ensuring business continuity and data availability. This feature is specifically designed for disaster recovery and data backup purposes.
questions.verified_answer: Set up Amazon S3 cross-region replication to another AWS Region

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud service can send alerts to customers if custom spending thresholds are exceeded?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows users to set custom spending thresholds and receive alerts when those thresholds are exceeded. This service helps users stay on top of their costs and make informed decisions about their AWS spending.

questions.question: What is the recommended method to request penetration testing on AWS resources?
options: Fill out the Penetration Testing Request Form
Request a penetration test from your technical account manager
questions.answer: Fill out the Penetration Testing Request Form
questions.explanation: To request penetration testing on AWS resources, you should fill out the Penetration Testing Request Form, which is the recommended method. This form is available on the AWS website and allows you to request a penetration test for your AWS resources.
questions.verified_answer: Fill out the Penetration Testing Request Form

questions.question: A user needs to automatically discover, classify, and protect sensitive data stored in Amazon S3. Which AWS service can meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon Macie is a service that automatically discovers, classifies, and protects sensitive data stored in Amazon S3. It uses machine learning to identify and classify sensitive data, and provides features to protect and monitor that data.

questions.question: Which components are required to build a successful site-to-site VPN connection on AWS? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: A customer gateway is required to establish a site-to-site VPN connection between an on-premises network and an AWS network. A virtual private gateway is also required to establish a site-to-site VPN connection on the AWS side.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 pricing option is best suited for applications with short-term, spiky, or unpredictable workloads that cannot be interrupted?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are best suited for applications with short-term, spiky, or unpredictable workloads that cannot be interrupted, as they offer significant cost savings but can be interrupted by AWS if the Spot Price exceeds the bid price.

questions.question: Which AWS cloud architecture principle states that systems should reduce interdependencies?
questions.explanation: The principle of loose coupling in AWS cloud architecture emphasizes reducing interdependencies between components to improve system resilience and scalability. This principle is essential for designing fault-tolerant and highly available systems.

questions.question: What is the MOST effective resource for staying up to date on AWS security announcements?
questions.explanation: AWS Security Bulletins is the most effective resource for staying up to date on AWS security announcements as it provides timely and detailed information about security vulnerabilities and patches. This resource helps customers stay informed and take necessary actions to secure their AWS environments.

questions.question: Which AWS service offers persistent storage for a file system?
questions.explanation: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) provides persistent storage for a file system, allowing it to be attached to and detached from EC2 instances as needed. This makes it ideal for applications that require a persistent file system.

questions.question: Which of the following allows AWS users to manage cost allocations for billing?
options: Running all operations on a single AWS account
questions.explanation: Tagging resources allows AWS users to manage cost allocations for billing by assigning metadata to resources, enabling accurate cost tracking and allocation. This feature is a key component of AWS Cost Explorer and helps users optimize their costs.

questions.question: Which of the following tasks can only be performed after signing in with AWS account root user credentials? (Choose two.)
options: Attaching a role to an Amazon EC2 instance
Generating access keys for IAM users
questions.explanation: Closing an AWS account can only be performed after signing in with AWS account root user credentials. Changing AWS Support plans also requires root user credentials, as it involves modifying the account's support settings.

questions.question: Fault tolerance refers to:
options: the ability of an application to accommodate growth without changing design
how well and how quickly an application’s environment can have lost data restored
the built-in redundancy of an application’s components
questions.answer: the built-in redundancy of an application’s components
questions.explanation: Fault tolerance refers to the ability of a system to continue operating even when one or more components fail. This is achieved through built-in redundancy, which ensures that critical components are duplicated to prevent data loss or system downtime.
questions.verified_answer: the built-in redundancy of an application’s components

questions.question: A company operating in the AWS Cloud requires separate invoices for specific environments, such as development, testing, and production. How can this be achieved?
questions.explanation: Using multiple AWS accounts allows for separate billing and invoicing for different environments, such as development, testing, and production. This is because each AWS account has its own billing and cost allocation, making it easier to track and manage costs for each environment.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used in the application deployment process?
questions.explanation: AWS CodePipeline is a fully managed continuous delivery service that automates the build, test, and deployment of applications. It is the most suitable option for the application deployment process among the given choices.

questions.question: What can be used to reduce the cost of running Amazon EC2 instances? (Choose two.)
options: Spot Instances for stateless and flexible workloads
Memory optimized instances for high-compute workloads
On-Demand Instances for high-cost and sustained workloads
Spend limits set using AWS Budgets
answer: Spot Instances for stateless and flexible workloads
questions.explanation: Spot Instances can be used to reduce costs for stateless and flexible workloads by bidding on unused EC2 capacity. Reserved Instances can be used to reduce costs for sustained workloads by committing to a one- or three-year term.
questions.verified_answer: Spot Instances for stateless and flexible workloads, Reserved Instances for sustained workloads

questions.question: A company is launching an e-commerce site that will store and process credit card data. The company requires information about AWS compliance reports and AWS agreements. Which AWS service provides on-demand access to these items?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to AWS compliance reports and agreements, making it the correct choice for the company's e-commerce site that requires sensitive credit card data storage and processing.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to track unauthorized API calls?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail is a service that records API calls made within an AWS account, allowing for tracking of unauthorized API calls. It provides a detailed history of all AWS API calls made within an account, including API calls made by users, roles, or AWS services.

questions.question: A user needs to regularly audit and evaluate the setup of all AWS resources, identify non-compliant accounts, and be notified when a resource changes. Which AWS service can be used to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Config is used to evaluate and audit the setup of AWS resources, identify non-compliant accounts, and provide notifications when resources change. It provides a detailed inventory of AWS resources and their configurations, allowing for easy auditing and compliance checks.

questions.question: A user is planning to launch two additional Amazon EC2 instances to increase availability. Which action should the user take?
options: Launch the instances across multiple Availability Zones in a single AWS Region.
Launch the instances as EC2 Reserved Instances in the same AWS Region and the same Availability Zone.
Launch the instances in multiple AWS Regions, but in the same Availability Zone.
Launch the instances as EC2 Spot Instances in the same AWS Region, but in different Availability Zones.
questions.answer: Launch the instances across multiple Availability Zones in a single AWS Region.
questions.explanation: Launching instances across multiple Availability Zones in a single AWS Region provides high availability and redundancy, as if one Availability Zone goes down, the other can still be accessed. This is a best practice for increasing availability and minimizing downtime.
questions.verified_answer: Launch the instances across multiple Availability Zones in a single AWS Region.

questions.question: A company’s application has flexible start and end times. Which Amazon EC2 pricing model will be the MOST cost-effective?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are the most cost-effective option for flexible start and end times because they allow the company to bid on unused EC2 capacity, resulting in significant cost savings. However, the company must be prepared to terminate the instance if the bid is not accepted or if the instance is interrupted.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, what are the customer’s responsibilities? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The customer is responsible for the security of data in transit, which includes encrypting data when it is sent over the internet. Additionally, the customer is responsible for data integrity authentication, which involves verifying the accuracy and completeness of data.

questions.question: A cloud practitioner has a data analysis workload that is infrequently executed and can be interrupted without harm. To optimize for cost, which Amazon EC2 purchasing option should be used?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are ideal for workloads that can be interrupted without harm, as they offer significant cost savings by bidding on unused EC2 capacity. This option is suitable for infrequently executed data analysis workloads.

questions.question: Which AWS container service will help a user install, operate, and scale the cluster management infrastructure?
questions.explanation: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) is a container orchestration service that helps users install, operate, and scale the cluster management infrastructure. It allows users to run and manage containerized applications in a highly available and scalable manner.

questions.question: Which of the following allows an application running on an Amazon EC2 instance to securely write data to an Amazon S3 bucket without using long term credentials?
questions.explanation: An AWS IAM role allows an application running on an Amazon EC2 instance to securely write data to an Amazon S3 bucket without using long term credentials, as the role is assumed by the instance at runtime. This approach is more secure than using long-term credentials, which can be compromised if leaked.

questions.question: A company with a Developer-level AWS Support plan provisioned an Amazon RDS database and cannot connect to it. Who should the developer contact for this level of support?
options: AWS Support using a support case
questions.answer: AWS Support using a support case
questions.explanation: The Developer-level AWS Support plan provides 24/7 access to the AWS Support Center and support cases for assistance with AWS services, including Amazon RDS. The developer should contact AWS Support using a support case to troubleshoot and resolve the connection issue.
questions.verified_answer: AWS Support using a support case

questions.question: What is the purpose of having an internet gateway within a VPC?
options: To create a VPN connection to the VPC
To allow communication between the VPC and the Internet
To impose bandwidth constraints on internet traffic
To load balance traffic from the Internet across Amazon EC2 instances
questions.answer: To allow communication between the VPC and the Internet
questions.explanation: An internet gateway is used to enable instances in a VPC to connect to the internet. It allows incoming and outgoing traffic to and from the internet, making it a crucial component for VPCs that need to communicate with the outside world.
questions.verified_answer: To allow communication between the VPC and the Internet

questions.question: A company must ensure that its endpoint for a database instance remains the same after a single Availability Zone service interruption. The application needs to resume database operations without the need for manual administrative intervention. How can these requirements be met?
options: Use multiple Amazon Route 53 routes to the standby database instance endpoint hosted
questions.explanation: SKIPPED: Source JSON missing answer or options.

questions.question: Which AWS managed service can be used to distribute traffic between one or more Amazon EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancing is an AWS managed service that distributes traffic across multiple EC2 instances, improving application availability and scalability. It can handle traffic for web servers, applications, and APIs.

questions.question: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations on which of the following? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations on cost optimization and performance. It also offers guidance on security, fault tolerance, and service limits, but these are not among the options provided.

questions.question: When comparing AWS Cloud with on-premises Total Cost of Ownership, which expenses must be considered? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: When comparing AWS Cloud with on-premises Total Cost of Ownership, expenses such as physical storage hardware should be considered as they directly contribute to the overall cost. This includes the cost of purchasing and maintaining physical storage devices.

questions.question: A company uses Amazon EC2 infrastructure to host steady-state workloads and needs to achieve significant cost savings. Which EC2 instance pricing model should the company select?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide significant cost savings compared to On-Demand Instances, making them a suitable choice for steady-state workloads. By committing to a one-year or three-year term, the company can achieve a discounted hourly rate for the reserved instances.

questions.question: Which guideline is a well-architected design principle for building cloud applications?
options: Keep static data closer to compute resources.
Design for automated recovery from failure.
questions.answer: Design for automated recovery from failure.
questions.explanation: This principle emphasizes the importance of designing systems that can automatically recover from failures, ensuring high availability and minimizing downtime. This is a key aspect of a well-architected design in the cloud.
questions.verified_answer: Design for automated recovery from failure.

questions.question: A security officer wants a list of any potential vulnerabilities in Amazon EC2 security groups. Which AWS service should the officer use?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides best practices and checks for security, performance, and cost optimization, including security group configuration. It can identify potential vulnerabilities in Amazon EC2 security groups.

questions.question: A company has multiple departments. Each department uses its own AWS account. Which AWS service or tool can the company use to combine the billing for all accounts into one bill?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows you to consolidate billing for multiple AWS accounts into a single bill, making it easier to manage and track expenses across your organization.

questions.question: A cloud practitioner needs to obtain AWS compliance reports before migrating an environment to the AWS Cloud. How can these reports be generated?
options: Download the reports from AWS Artifact
Open a case with AWS Support
Generate the reports with Amazon Macie
questions.answer: Download the reports from AWS Artifact
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to compliance reports and artifacts for AWS services, allowing cloud practitioners to easily obtain the necessary information before migrating their environment to the AWS Cloud.
questions.verified_answer: Download the reports from AWS Artifact

questions.question: A large company has a workload that requires hardware to remain on premises. The company wants to use the same management and control plane services that it currently uses on AWS. Which AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Outposts allows companies to run AWS services on their own premises, providing the same management and control plane services as AWS. This meets the company's requirement of keeping hardware on premises while still utilizing AWS services.

questions.question: Which tasks require using AWS account root user credentials? (Choose two.)
options: Creating an Amazon EC2 key pair
Removing an IAM user from the administrators group
Creating an Amazon CloudFront key pair
Granting an IAM user full administrative access
answer: Granting an IAM user full administrative access
questions.explanation: Changing the AWS Support plan requires root user credentials as it involves modifying the account's support settings. Granting an IAM user full administrative access also requires root user credentials as it involves modifying the user's permissions at the account level.
questions.verified_answer: Changing the AWS Support plan, Granting an IAM user full administrative access

questions.question: Which of the following are advantages of using Amazon EC2 instances over traditional on-premises servers? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 instances offer pay-as-you-go pricing, allowing users to only pay for the resources they use. Additionally, EC2 instances provide agility, enabling users to quickly scale up or down to meet changing business needs.

questions.question: To avoid malicious compute activities, a user needs a quick way to determine if any Amazon EC2 instances have ports that allow unrestricted access. Which AWS service will support this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor is a service that provides best practice checks and cost optimization recommendations for AWS resources, but it does not provide real-time monitoring of network traffic. VPC Flow Logs, on the other hand, can be used to capture information about network traffic going in and out of instances, allowing for the detection of unrestricted access.

questions.question: What are the market advantages of running workloads in the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
options: Less staff time is required to deploy new workloads.
Increased time to market for new application features.
Higher acquisition costs to support peak workloads.
Increased productivity for application development teams.
A decrease in the average server CPU utilization.
answer: Less staff time is required to deploy new workloads.
Increased productivity for application development teams.
questions.explanation: Running workloads in the AWS Cloud allows for automation and scalability, reducing the need for manual intervention and increasing the efficiency of application development teams. This leads to faster deployment and reduced costs.
questions.verified_answer: Less staff time is required to deploy new workloads., Increased productivity for application development teams.

questions.question: Which Amazon S3 storage class allows users to store data backups for long periods of time at the LOWEST cost?
options: S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access (S3 One Zone-IA)
questions.answer: S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access (S3 One Zone-IA)
questions.explanation: S3 One Zone-IA is designed for infrequently accessed data and provides the lowest cost for long-term storage. It is a cost-effective option for storing data backups for extended periods.
questions.verified_answer: S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access (S3 One Zone-IA)

questions.question: Which of the following technologies provides a secure network connection from on premises to AWS?
questions.explanation: A Virtual Private Network (VPN) provides a secure network connection from on-premises to AWS, allowing for encrypted communication between the two environments. This is achieved through the use of VPN connections, which can be established using AWS VPN Gateways or third-party VPN solutions.

questions.question: When using Amazon RDS, what is the customer responsible for?
options: Patching and maintenance of the underlying operating system.
Managing automatic backups of the database.
Controlling network access through security groups.
Replacing failed instances in the event of a hardware failure.
questions.answer: Controlling network access through security groups.
questions.explanation: When using Amazon RDS, the customer is responsible for controlling network access through security groups, which is a key aspect of database security. This includes configuring security groups to allow or deny access to the database instance.
questions.verified_answer: Controlling network access through security groups.

questions.question: Which controls are shared under the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)
options: Service and communications protection or security
questions.explanation: The AWS shared responsibility model divides responsibilities between AWS and the customer. Awareness and training, and configuration management are shared responsibilities as they require joint effort from both AWS and the customer.

questions.question: A company has decided to migrate its production workloads to the AWS Cloud. Which actions can help reduce operational costs as part of the migration? (Choose two.)
options: Rehost all third-party licenses on AWS.
questions.explanation: Reducing overprovisioned instances helps lower costs by avoiding unnecessary resource usage. Using managed services, such as RDS or S3, can also reduce costs by eliminating the need for in-house management and maintenance.

questions.question: Which design principles are enabled by the AWS Cloud to improve the operation of workloads? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Loose coupling is a design principle that enables components to be developed, tested, and deployed independently, which is enabled by the AWS Cloud's scalability and on-demand resources. Server design and concurrency are also enabled by the AWS Cloud, allowing for efficient use of resources and improved scalability.
questions.verified_answer: Loose coupling, Server design and concurrency

questions.question: To optimize costs and resource usage, a company needs to monitor the operational health of its entire system of AWS Cloud resources. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring service that provides data and business metrics for AWS resources, allowing companies to monitor the operational health of their entire system of AWS Cloud resources. It helps optimize costs and resource usage by providing real-time monitoring and alerting capabilities.

questions.question: If a user has an AWS account with an Enterprise-level AWS Support plan, who is the primary point of contact for billing or account inquiries?
questions.explanation: With an Enterprise-level AWS Support plan, the primary point of contact for billing or account inquiries is the AWS Concierge Support team, which provides personalized support and account management.

questions.question: Which AWS service will track user activity on AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail is a service that provides a record of actions taken by users, including API calls, in AWS. It helps track user activity and provides a history of changes made to AWS resources.

questions.question: A cloud practitioner needs an effective method to decrease application latency and increase performance for end users. Which services will help? (Choose two.)
options: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) for Kubernetes
questions.explanation: Amazon ElastiCache helps decrease application latency by providing a cache layer between the application and database, reducing the number of database queries. Amazon CloudFront increases performance by caching static and dynamic web content at edge locations, reducing the distance between end users and the content.

questions.question: A company is building a business intelligence solution and wants to use dashboards for reporting purposes. Which AWS service can be used?
questions.explanation: Amazon QuickSight is a fast, cloud-powered business intelligence service that makes it easy to visualize and analyze data. It's designed for business users and doesn't require any technical expertise to create interactive dashboards and reports.

questions.question: A company needs to transfer a large volume of data from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud. The companyג€™s internet connectivity is slow and unreliable. Which AWS service can facilitate this data transfer?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball is a petabyte-scale data transfer service that can be used to transfer large volumes of data from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud, even with slow and unreliable internet connectivity. It uses physical appliances to transfer data, making it a suitable solution for this scenario.

questions.question: Which pricing model will interrupt a running Amazon EC2 instance if capacity becomes temporarily unavailable?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are a type of EC2 instance that can be interrupted if the capacity becomes temporarily unavailable. This is because Spot Instances are priced on a competitive bidding model, where the user bids on the price they are willing to pay for the instance, and AWS can interrupt the instance if a higher bidder is found.

questions.question: Which security-related task is the responsibility of the customer in the AWS Cloud?
options: Maintaining firewall configurations at a hardware level
questions.explanation: In the AWS Cloud, customers are responsible for maintaining server-side encryption, which involves encrypting data at rest or in transit. This is a key aspect of data security and is typically handled by the customer, not AWS.

questions.question: Which AWS service acts as a data extract, transform, and load (ETL) tool to make it easy to prepare data for analytics?
questions.explanation: AWS Glue is a fully managed extract, transform, and load (ETL) service that makes it easy to prepare and load data for analysis. It can automatically detect and clean data, and transform it into a format suitable for analytics.
