questions.explanation: The AWS Basic Support plan provides access to AWS senior support engineers for technical assistance. They can help with troubleshooting and resolving issues, but may not have the same level of expertise as AWS senior support engineers in higher-tier plans.

questions.question: A company needs to migrate its on-premises data to the AWS Cloud. The company requires elastic, highly optimized connectivity. Which AWS service meets these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Storage Gateway provides on-premises storage that can be integrated with the AWS Cloud, offering elastic and highly optimized connectivity. It allows for seamless migration of data to the cloud while maintaining on-premises storage capabilities.

questions.question: When an Amazon EC2 instance is terminated, which AWS service can identify the user that made the API call?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail is a service that captures API calls made within an AWS account, including those made to terminate an EC2 instance. It provides a record of all API calls made, including the user who made the call.

questions.question: Which controls does the customer fully inherit from AWS in the AWS shared responsibility model?
questions.explanation: In the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for physical and environmental controls, such as data center security and power infrastructure. This means that customers do not need to manage these controls, allowing them to focus on their applications and data.

questions.question: Which feature can be used to protect Amazon S3 buckets from accidental overwrites or deletes?
questions.explanation: Object versioning allows you to keep multiple versions of an object in an S3 bucket, preventing accidental overwrites or deletes. This feature is particularly useful for maintaining a record of changes made to objects over time.

questions.question: Which of the following are AWS security best practices for using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) to manage an AWS account root user? (Choose two.)
options: Set up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user.
Remove all IAM policies from the root user.
Delete the root user access keys.
Use the root user for daily tasks.
Assign a read-only access policy to the root user.
answer: Set up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user.
Assign a read-only access policy to the root user.
questions.explanation: Setting up MFA for the root user adds an extra layer of security to prevent unauthorized access. Assigning a read-only access policy to the root user limits the damage that can be done in case the root user's credentials are compromised.
questions.verified_answer: Set up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user. Assign a read-only access policy to the root user.

questions.question: Service control policies (SCPs) manage permissions for which of the following?
questions.explanation: Service control policies (SCPs) are used to manage permissions for AWS Organizations, allowing administrators to define the permissions and access controls for their organization and its members. This includes controlling access to AWS services and resources within the organization.

questions.question: A database administrator is trying to determine who deleted a critical Amazon Redshift cluster. Which AWS service helps with monitoring and retaining this type of account activity?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail is a service that helps monitor and retain account activity, including API calls and actions taken within AWS services. It captures detailed information about who made changes to AWS resources, including Amazon Redshift clusters.

questions.question: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework includes the AWS shared responsibility model?
questions.explanation: The AWS shared responsibility model is actually a concept that applies to all pillars of the Well-Architected Framework, but it is most closely related to the Security pillar. However, the correct pillar that includes the AWS shared responsibility model is actually 'Operational excellence'.

questions.question: A company runs its business-critical web application on Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) and Amazon DynamoDB. The workload spikes up to 10 times the normal workload multiple times during the day. Which AWS Cloud feature enables the company to meet these changes in demand?
questions.explanation: Scalability is the ability of a system to adapt to changes in demand, such as the workload spikes described in the question. This is a key feature of cloud computing that allows companies to quickly scale up or down to meet changing needs.

questions.question: A company’s traffic logs show that IP addresses owned by AWS are being used in an attempt to flood ports on system resources. To whom should the cloud practitioner report this issue?
questions.explanation: The AWS Abuse team is responsible for handling reports of abuse, including attempts to flood ports on system resources. Reporting this issue to the AWS Abuse team will help them take necessary actions to mitigate the problem.

questions.question: An Amazon EC2 instance previously used for development is inaccessible and no longer appears in the AWS Management Console. Which AWS service should be used to determine what action made this EC2 instance inaccessible?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail is used to record events related to AWS services, including API calls and changes to resources. This allows you to track and analyze the actions taken in your AWS account, including those that may have made an EC2 instance inaccessible.

questions.question: Which AWS service is a highly available and scalable DNS web service?
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable DNS web service that provides low-latency, high-performance routing to your applications. It is designed to provide high availability and scalability for your DNS needs.

questions.question: A company is moving its office and must establish an encrypted connection to AWS. Which AWS service will help meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS VPN (Virtual Private Network) allows companies to establish a secure and encrypted connection between their on-premises network and AWS. This enables them to securely transfer data between their office and AWS resources.

questions.question: Which statement explains the benefit of agility in the AWS Cloud?
options: Agility gives users the ability to host applications in multiple AWS Regions around the
questions.explanation: SKIPPED: Source JSON missing answer or options.

questions.question: Which of the following are user authentication services managed by AWS? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon Cognito is a user identity and access management service that provides features such as user pools, identity pools, and federated identities. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) is a service that helps you securely control access to AWS resources by managing users, groups, and permissions.
questions.verified_answer: Amazon Cognito, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)

questions.question: Which AWS service or tool helps identify underutilized Amazon EC2 instances and idle Amazon RDS DB instances at no additional charge?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor is a free service that provides best practice checks, covering best practices for security, performance, and service limits. It can identify underutilized Amazon EC2 instances and idle Amazon RDS DB instances, helping users optimize their resources.

questions.question: Which of the following are customer responsibilities under the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)
options: Encryption of customer data on AWS
Management of network throughput of each AWS Region
answer: Management of network throughput of each AWS Region
questions.explanation: The customer is responsible for the configuration of security groups, which is a key aspect of their security and compliance. Management of AWS Lambda infrastructure and management of network throughput of each AWS Region are actually AWS responsibilities under the shared responsibility model.

questions.question: A user should contact the AWS Abuse team to report which situations? (Choose two.)
options: A DDoS attack is being made on an AWS resource.
A SQL injection attack is being made from an IP address that is not an AWS address.
AWS resources are being used to host objectionable or illegal content.
A company’s resources are being used in a way that is inconsistent with corporate
answer: A DDoS attack is being made on an AWS resource.
AWS resources are being used to host objectionable or illegal content.
questions.explanation: The AWS Abuse team handles reports of abuse, including DDoS attacks on AWS resources and hosting of objectionable or illegal content. The other options are not directly related to AWS Abuse team's responsibilities.
verified_answer: A DDoS attack is being made on an AWS resource.
AWS resources are being used to host objectionable or illegal content.

questions.question: A company uses Amazon DynamoDB in its AWS Cloud architecture. According to the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following are responsibilities of the company? (Choose two.)
options: Application of appropriate permissions with IAM tools
answer: Application of appropriate permissions with IAM tools
questions.explanation: The company is responsible for applying appropriate permissions with IAM tools to manage access to DynamoDB. However, the creation of DynamoDB endpoints is not a responsibility of the company, as AWS manages the endpoints for DynamoDB.
verified_answer: Application of appropriate permissions with IAM tools

questions.question: What should a user do to deploy an application in geographically separate locations?
options: Deploy the application in different placement groups.
Deploy the application to a VPC.
Deploy the application to multiple AWS Regions.
Deploy the application by using Amazon CloudFront.
questions.answer: Deploy the application to multiple AWS Regions.
questions.explanation: Deploying an application to multiple AWS Regions allows it to be accessible from geographically separate locations, reducing latency and improving availability. This is because each AWS Region is a separate geographic location with its own set of data centers.
questions.verified_answer: Deploy the application to multiple AWS Regions.

questions.question: A company wants to rightsize its infrastructure to control costs. At which points should the company rightsize? (Choose two.)
options: Rightsize before a migration occurs to the cloud.
Rightsize continuously after the cloud onboarding process.
Rightsize when AWS Support calls and explains that rightsizing is needed.
Rightsize when seasonal workloads are at their peak.
Rightsize after purchasing all Reserved Instances.
answer: Rightsize when seasonal workloads are at their peak.
Rightsize after purchasing all Reserved Instances.
questions.explanation: The company should rightsize when seasonal workloads are at their peak to avoid overprovisioning and reduce costs. Additionally, right-sizing after purchasing all Reserved Instances ensures that the company is not wasting resources and is making the most of their reserved instances.
questions.verified_answer: Rightsize when seasonal workloads are at their peak. Rightsize after purchasing all Reserved Instances.

questions.question: Which tasks should a user perform if the user suspects that an AWS account has been compromised? (Choose two.)
options: Rotate and delete all AWS access keys.
Move resources to a different AWS Region.
answer: Rotate and delete all AWS access keys.
questions.explanation: When an AWS account is suspected to be compromised, it's essential to immediately rotate and delete all AWS access keys to prevent further unauthorized access. Contacting AWS Support is also crucial to report the incident and receive guidance on the next steps to secure the account.
questions.verified_answer: Rotate and delete all AWS access keys. Contact AWS Support.

questions.question: A company needs a content delivery network that provides secure delivery of data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency and high transfer speed. Which AWS service meets these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency and high transfer speed. It caches content at edge locations around the world, reducing the distance between users and the content they request.

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud benefit is shown by an architecture’s ability to withstand failures with minimal downtime?
questions.explanation: High availability refers to the ability of a system to withstand failures with minimal downtime, ensuring that the system remains operational and accessible to users. This is a key benefit of designing architectures with high availability in mind.

questions.question: A company is moving its development and test environments to AWS to increase agility and reduce cost. Because these are not production workloads and the servers are not fully utilized, occasional unavailability is acceptable. What is the MOST cost-effective Amazon EC2 pricing model that will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are the most cost-effective option because they allow for occasional unavailability and can provide up to 90% discount compared to On-Demand Instances. This pricing model is suitable for non-production workloads that can tolerate occasional interruptions.

questions.question: Which guidelines are key AWS architectural design principles? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The correct answer aligns with AWS's architectural design principles, which emphasize scalability and the use of managed services to reduce complexity and improve efficiency.
questions.verified_answer: Build scalable architectures. Use managed services when possible.

questions.question: What is the LEAST expensive AWS Support plan that provides 24-hour access to AWS customer service and AWS communities?
questions.explanation: AWS Basic Support is the least expensive plan that provides 24-hour access to AWS customer service and AWS communities. It offers a self-service portal, email support, and access to AWS communities, making it suitable for customers who require basic support.

questions.question: A company with AWS Enterprise Support has questions about its consolidated bill. Which AWS service, feature, or tool should the company use for assistance?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor is a tool that provides real-time guidance to help optimize AWS usage, reduce costs, and improve performance. It can also assist with billing and cost-related issues, making it the correct choice for assistance with the consolidated bill.

questions.question: A company needs to perform a one-time migration of 40TB of data from its on-premises storage servers to Amazon S3. The transfer must happen as quickly as possible while keeping costs to a minimum. The company has 100 Mbps internet connectivity. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball is a petabyte-scale data transfer service that can transfer large amounts of data quickly and securely to the cloud. It is ideal for one-time migrations of large datasets like the 40TB in this scenario.

questions.question: A company uses Amazon S3 buckets. One of the company’s departments enabled S3 CrossRegion Replication for those buckets to meet new requirements. The company’s bill for that month was larger than usual. Which AWS service or feature can the company use to confirm that the cost increase was caused by the data replication?
questions.explanation: Cost Explorer is a service that allows users to view and analyze their AWS cost and usage data. It can help identify the source of cost increases, such as data replication in this case.

questions.question: A company wants to store data with high availability, encrypt the data at rest, and have direct access to the data over the internet. Which AWS service will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 meets the requirements of high availability, encryption at rest, and direct access to data over the internet. It is also the most cost-effective option among the given choices, as it provides a scalable and durable object storage service.

questions.question: How do AWS users trade infrastructure expenses for operational expenses?
options: Secure their physical infrastructure to prevent malicious attacks.
Use AWS Budgets to ensure that spending on AWS resources does not exceed preset thresholds.
Eliminate the electricity costs that are associated with the hosting of physical servers.
Use AWS Auto Scaling to dynamically increase and decrease compute resources as needed.
questions.answer: Use AWS Auto Scaling to dynamically increase and decrease compute resources as needed.
questions.explanation: AWS users can trade infrastructure expenses for operational expenses by using services like AWS Auto Scaling, which allows them to dynamically adjust their compute resources based on demand, reducing the need for upfront infrastructure investments and associated costs.
questions.verified_answer: Use AWS Auto Scaling to dynamically increase and decrease compute resources as needed.

questions.question: A network engineer needs to establish a dedicated 10 Gbps network connection from an on premises environment to AWS. Which AWS service or feature should the engineer use?
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect is a service that makes it possible to establish a dedicated network connection from an on-premises environment to AWS. This connection is a high-bandwidth, low-latency link that can be used to transfer data between the on-premises environment and AWS.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature provides an online, managed software catalog that helps users purchase and deploy third-party software?
options: Amazon EC2 private Amazon Machine Images (AMIs)
questions.explanation: AWS Marketplace is an online store that allows customers to easily find, purchase, and deploy third-party software that runs on AWS. It provides a managed software catalog, making it the correct answer to the question.

questions.question: A company has a Java web application. The company wants to use auto deployment to create the AWS environment and deploy new versions of its application. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk is a service that allows for the deployment of web applications and services to the cloud. It supports auto-scaling, load balancing, and other features that meet the company's requirements.

questions.question: Which action will provide documentation to help a company evaluate whether its use of the AWS Cloud is compliant with local regulatory standards?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to compliance reports and artifacts, helping companies evaluate their compliance with local regulatory standards. This includes reports on AWS's security controls, data protection, and compliance with various regulations.

questions.question: A company is launching a new application in the AWS Cloud. The application will run on an Amazon EC2 instance. More EC2 instances will be needed when the workload increases. Which AWS service or tool can the company use to launch the number of EC2 instances that will be needed to handle the workload?
questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancing is used to distribute traffic across multiple EC2 instances, but it doesn't automatically launch new instances when the workload increases. Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling is the correct service to use for scaling EC2 instances based on workload demands.

questions.question: A company has infrastructure in one AWS Region and is expanding operations to a second AWS Region. The company is using the same AWS CloudFormation template in the second Region that the company uses in the original Region. The company attempts to launch Amazon EC2 OnDemand Instances in the second Region and receives error messages. What could cause these error messages?
options: A new EC2 key pair has not been created for the EC2 instances.
The requested EC2 instance types are not available in the second Region.
The company cannot operate in a second Region until it updates its AWS contract.
The company has not configured AWS Budgets to monitor the budget for the EC2
questions.answer: A new EC2 key pair has not been created for the EC2 instances.
questions.explanation: This is because AWS CloudFormation templates are region-specific and do not automatically create resources in a new region. If the key pair was created in the original region, it needs to be recreated in the second region for the EC2 instances to launch successfully.
questions.verified_answer: A new EC2 key pair has not been created for the EC2 instances.

questions.question: Which of the following is a software development framework that a company can use to define cloud resources as code and provision the resources through AWS CloudFormation?
questions.explanation: AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK) is an open-source software development framework that allows developers to define cloud resources as code and provision them through AWS CloudFormation. It provides a set of languages and tools to define cloud infrastructure in a declarative and programmatic way.

questions.question: Which options are available to a user who wants to contact AWS Support? (Choose two.)
options: Create an email case in the AWS Support Center.
Visit a local AWS Support Center.
Call the customer service phone number. E. Use the video conference functionality of
answer: Call the customer service phone number. E. Use the video conference functionality of
questions.explanation: The user can contact AWS Support through live chat, phone, or video conference. The AWS Support Center and local AWS Support Center are not valid options for contacting AWS Support directly.
verified_answer: Call the customer service phone number.
Use the video conference functionality of

questions.question: A global company is building a simple time-tracking mobile app. The app needs to operate globally and must store collected data in a database. Data must be accessible from the AWS Region that is closest to the user. What should the company do to meet these data storage requirements with the LEAST amount of operational overhead?
options: Use Amazon EC2 in multiple Regions to host separate databases.
Use AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS).
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB global tables allow for a single table to be replicated across multiple AWS Regions, enabling data to be accessed from the Region closest to the user with minimal operational overhead. This approach meets the company's requirements for global data storage and accessibility.

questions.question: A company plans to store sensitive data in an Amazon S3 bucket. Which task is the responsibility of AWS?
options: Activate encryption at rest for the data.
Provide security for the physical infrastructure.
Train the company’s employees about cloud security.
Remove personally identifiable information (PII) from the data.
questions.answer: Activate encryption at rest for the data.
questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for providing the necessary security features for its services, including encryption at rest for Amazon S3 data. This ensures that sensitive data is protected from unauthorized access.
questions.verified_answer: Activate encryption at rest for the data.

questions.question: A company needs a firewall that will control network connections to and from a single Amazon EC2 instance. This firewall will not control network connections to and from other instances that are in the same subnet. Which AWS service or feature can the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Security groups are used to control inbound and outbound traffic to and from a single EC2 instance, and do not affect other instances in the same subnet. They are the correct choice for this scenario because they are instance-level firewalls.

questions.question: Which of the following are AWS Trusted Advisor support categories? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The given answer is correct as Cost optimization and Security are two of the main categories of AWS Trusted Advisor. AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations for Operational excellence, Cost optimization, Performance, Security, Fault tolerance, and Service limits categories.

questions.question: Which of the following is entirely the responsibility of AWS, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: Patching of the guest operating system
Development of an IAM password policy
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for the physical and environmental controls of the infrastructure, including the data centers and network infrastructure. This includes security measures such as access controls, surveillance, and power and cooling systems.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to decouple applications?
questions.explanation: Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) is a fully managed message queuing service that enables decoupling of applications by allowing them to send and receive messages asynchronously. This helps improve the scalability and reliability of applications.

questions.question: A financial services company wants to ensure that its AWS account activity is logged to meet regulatory requirements for logging, auditing, and governance. Which AWS service meets these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail is a service that provides a record of actions taken by users, roles, or services in an AWS account. It helps meet regulatory requirements for logging, auditing, and governance by capturing API calls and changes to AWS resources.

questions.question: A company implements an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling policy along with an Application Load Balancer to automatically recover unhealthy applications that run on Amazon EC2 instances. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this action cover?
questions.explanation: This action covers the Reliability pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework because it ensures that the application can recover from failures and maintain its availability. The use of an Auto Scaling policy and an Application Load Balancer helps to detect and mitigate unhealthy instances, thereby improving the overall reliability of the application.

questions.question: A retail company needs to build a highly available architecture for a new ecommerce platform. The company is using the only AWS services that replicate data across multiple Availability Zones. Which AWS services should the company use to meet this requirement? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon Aurora is a relational database service that replicates data across multiple Availability Zones, ensuring high availability. Amazon DynamoDB is a NoSQL database service that also replicates data across multiple Availability Zones, making it suitable for the company's requirement.

questions.question: Which AWS service uses edge locations?
questions.explanation: AWS Global Accelerator uses edge locations to reduce latency and improve the performance of applications by routing traffic through the nearest available location. This allows for faster and more reliable access to applications and services.

questions.question: A company wants to deploy some of its resources in the AWS Cloud. To meet regulatory requirements, the data must remain local and on premises. There must be low latency between AWS and the company resources. Which AWS service or feature can be used to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Outposts allows companies to deploy AWS resources on-premises, meeting the regulatory requirement of keeping data local. It also provides low latency between AWS and on-premises resources.

questions.question: What is the LEAST expensive AWS Support plan that provides a designated AWS technical account manager (TAM)?
questions.explanation: AWS Enterprise Support is the least expensive plan that provides a designated AWS technical account manager (TAM). This plan offers 24/7 access to AWS Support, including phone, email, and chat support, as well as a dedicated TAM to help with strategic planning and technical implementation.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature enables users to encrypt data at rest in Amazon S3?
questions.explanation: IAM policies are used to manage access and permissions to AWS resources, but they do not directly enable encryption of data at rest in Amazon S3. Server-side encryption is a feature provided by AWS that allows users to encrypt data at rest in S3 buckets.

questions.question: A company is moving multiple applications to a single AWS account. The company wants to monitor the AWS Cloud costs incurred by each application. What can the company do to meet this requirement?
options: Set the budgets in Cost Explorer.
questions.explanation: The company can create cost allocation tags to track the costs incurred by each application. This allows them to monitor and manage costs for each application separately within the single AWS account.

questions.question: A company is based in the us-east-1 Region and has a satellite office in the eu-west-2 Region. The company wants to use Amazon WorkSpaces to host its internal web portal and virtual desktops for employees. What should the company do to minimize latency and ensure the best possible performance for employees?
options: Deploy the internal web portal and virtual desktops to us-east-1 only. Use an Amazon CloudFront distribution for the users in eu-west-2.
Deploy the internal web portal to us-east-1 only. Deploy the virtual desktops to us-east-1 and eu-west-2.
Deploy the internal web portal to us-east-1 and eu-west-2. Deploy the virtual desktops on network optimized Amazon EC2 instances to us-east-1 only.
Deploy the internal web portal and virtual desktops to us-east-1 and eu-west-2.
questions.answer: Deploy the internal web portal to us-east-1 only. Deploy the virtual desktops to us-east-1 and eu-west-2.
questions.explanation: This option minimizes latency by hosting the internal web portal, which is likely to be accessed more frequently, in the same region as the company's headquarters. Deploying virtual desktops to both regions allows employees in eu-west-2 to access their desktops with lower latency.
questions.verified_answer: Deploy the internal web portal to us-east-1 only. Deploy the virtual desktops to us-east-1 and eu-west-2.

questions.question: A company is considering a move to the AWS Cloud. The company wants to be able to scale its compute resources as needed to accommodate changing loads. Which benefit of the AWS Cloud does this scenario describe?
questions.explanation: Elasticity in the AWS Cloud refers to the ability to scale compute resources up or down as needed to accommodate changing loads, making it a suitable choice for this scenario. This allows the company to quickly adapt to changing demands without having to provision and manage additional resources.

questions.question: A company runs its workloads on premises. The company wants to forecast the cost of running a large application on AWS. Which AWS service or tool can the company use to obtain this information?
questions.explanation: Cost Explorer is used to view and manage AWS cost and usage data, but it's not the best tool for forecasting costs. The AWS Pricing Calculator is the correct choice as it allows users to estimate costs for AWS services based on their usage and configuration.

questions.question: A company wants to provide managed Windows virtual desktops and applications to its remote employees over secure network connections. Which AWS services can the company use to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
options: AWS Site-to-Site VPN E. Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS)
answer: AWS Site-to-Site VPN E. Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS)
questions.explanation: Amazon WorkSpaces provides managed Windows virtual desktops, while AWS Site-to-Site VPN provides secure network connections. Amazon AppStream 2.0 can also be used to provide managed Windows virtual desktops and applications, making it a suitable choice.
questions.verified_answer: Amazon WorkSpaces, AWS Site-to-Site VPN and Amazon AppStream 2.0

questions.question: Which of the following is a managed AWS service that is used specifically for transform, and load (ETL) data?
questions.explanation: AWS Glue is a fully managed extract, transform, and load (ETL) service that makes it easy to prepare and load data for analysis. It can automatically detect and clean the structure of data, and transform it into a format that's ready for analysis.

questions.question: Which AWS service is always free of charge for users?
questions.explanation: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) is a free service provided by AWS, but it's not the correct answer to this question. The correct answer is actually none of the options provided, as none of the services listed are always free of charge for users.

questions.question: Which AWS services can be used to store files? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) is a block-level storage service, not a file-level storage service. AWS Storage Gateway is a service that connects on-premises software appliances with cloud-based storage, but it's not a primary file storage service.

questions.question: How does consolidated billing help reduce costs for a company that has multiple AWS accounts?
options: It aggregates usage across accounts so that the company can reach volume discount thresholds sooner.
It offers an additional 5% discount on purchases of AII Upfront Reserved Instances.
It provides a simplified billing invoice that the company can process more quickly than a standard invoice.
It gives AWS resellers the ability to bill their customers for usage.
questions.answer: It aggregates usage across accounts so that the company can reach volume discount thresholds sooner.
questions.explanation: Consolidated billing allows companies with multiple AWS accounts to aggregate their usage, making it easier to reach volume discount thresholds and reducing costs. This is because the total usage across all accounts is combined, allowing the company to take advantage of discounts more quickly.
questions.verified_answer: It aggregates usage across accounts so that the company can reach volume discount thresholds sooner.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature can be used to find availability status information on all AWSservices?
questions.explanation: The AWS Service Health Dashboard provides real-time information about the availability status of AWS services, allowing users to quickly identify any issues or outages. It is a dedicated service for monitoring the health of AWS services.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature provides users with recommendations for common billing questions?
questions.explanation: The AWS Knowledge Center provides users with recommendations for common billing questions, as well as other general information about AWS services and features.

questions.question: A company wants to distribute its incoming traffic across multiple Amazon EC2 instances. Which AWS service or feature should be used to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: The AWS Application Load Balancer distributes incoming traffic across multiple Amazon EC2 instances, ensuring that no single instance is overwhelmed. This helps improve the availability and scalability of the application.

questions.question: Which disaster recovery option is the LEAST expensive?
questions.explanation: Backup and restore is the least expensive disaster recovery option as it involves periodic backups of data and restoring it in case of a disaster, which is a relatively simple and cost-effective process. The other options, such as warm standby and multisite, require more complex infrastructure and resources, making them more expensive.

questions.question: A company uses a database that has a simple sign-up page to create users, and a basic login form to authenticate users so they can access the database. The company wants to give users the ability to store personal information, but the user access must be controlled in a more secure and reliable way. Which AWS service or feature will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon Cognito provides user identity and access management, allowing users to store personal information securely and controlling access to the database in a more secure and reliable way. Security groups are used to control traffic to and from AWS resources, but they do not provide user identity and access management.

questions.question: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework focuses on the ability to run workloads effectively, gain insight into operations, and continuously improve supporting processes and procedures?
questions.explanation: The Operational Excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework focuses on running workloads effectively, gaining insight into operations, and continuously improving supporting processes and procedures. This pillar helps organizations to improve their operational efficiency and effectiveness.

questions.question: Which AWS benefit is demonstrated by on-demand technology services that enable companies to replace upfront fixed expenses with variable expenses?
questions.explanation: On-demand technology services allow companies to pay only for the resources they use, replacing upfront fixed expenses with variable expenses. This aligns with the concept of pay-as-you-go pricing, which is a key benefit of cloud computing.

questions.question: A large organization has a single AWS account. What are the advantages of reconfiguring the single account into multiple AWS accounts? (Choose two.)
options: It allows for administrative isolation between different workloads.
Discounts can be applied on a quarterly basis by submitting cases in the AWS Management Console.
Transitioning objects from Amazon S3 to Amazon S3 Glacier in separate AWS accounts will be less expensive.
Having multiple accounts reduces the risks associated with malicious activity targeted at a single account.
Amazon QuickSight offers access to a cost tool that provides application-specific recommendations for environments running in multiple accounts.
answer: It allows for administrative isolation between different workloads.
Transitioning objects from Amazon S3 to Amazon S3 Glacier in separate AWS accounts will be less expensive.
questions.explanation: Reconfiguring a single AWS account into multiple accounts provides administrative isolation between different workloads, reducing the risk of a security breach affecting all workloads. Additionally, transitioning objects from Amazon S3 to Amazon S3 Glacier in separate accounts can be less expensive due to the lower storage costs of Glacier.
questions.verified_answer: It allows for administrative isolation between different workloads. Transitioning objects from Amazon S3 to Amazon S3 Glacier in separate AWS accounts will be less expensive.

questions.question: An online retail company recently deployed a production web application. The system administrator needs to block common attack patterns such as SQL injection and cross-site scripting. Which AWS service should the administrator use to address these concerns?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) is a web application firewall that helps protect web applications from common web exploits and SQL injection and cross-site scripting attacks. It can be used to create custom web security rules and protect web applications hosted on AWS or on-premises.

questions.question: What does Amazon CloudFront provide?
options: Automatic scaling for all resources to power an application from a single unified interface
Secure delivery of data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency
Ability to directly manage traffic globally through a variety of routing types, including  latency-based routing, geo DNS, geo-proximity, and weighted round robin
Automatic distribution of incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as Amazon EC2 instances, containers, IP addresses, and AWS Lambda functions
questions.answer: Secure delivery of data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency. It does this by caching content at edge locations around the world, reducing the distance between users and the content they need.
questions.verified_answer: Secure delivery of data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency

questions.question: Which phase describes agility as a benefit of building in the AWS Cloud?
options: The ability to pay only when computing resources are consumed, based on the volume of resources that are consumed
The ability to eliminate guessing about infrastructure capacity needs
The ability to support innovation through a reduction in the time that is required to make IT resources available to developers
The ability to deploy an application in multiple AWS Regions around the world in minutes
questions.answer: The ability to support innovation through a reduction in the time that is required to make IT resources available to developers
questions.explanation: This option describes agility as a benefit of building in the AWS Cloud, as it highlights the ability to quickly make IT resources available to developers, enabling innovation. This is a key advantage of cloud computing, allowing businesses to respond quickly to changing market conditions and customer needs.
questions.verified_answer: The ability to support innovation through a reduction in the time that is required to make IT resources available to developers

questions.question: A company is undergoing a security audit. The audit includes security validation and compliance validation of the AWS infrastructure and services that the company uses. The auditor needs to locate compliance-related information and must download AWS security and compliance documents. These documents include the System and Organization Control (SOC) reports. Which AWS service or group can provide these documents?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact is a service that provides on-demand access to AWS security and compliance reports, including SOC reports, to help customers meet their compliance requirements. It is the correct service to use for downloading these documents.

questions.question: Which AWS Trusted Advisor checks are available to users with AWS Basic Support? (Choose two.)
options: Large number of rules in an EC2 security groups
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor checks are categorized into four categories: Service limits, Security, Performance, and Cost Optimization. Users with AWS Basic Support have access to the Service limits and Security categories, which include the 'Service limits' and 'Security groups – specific ports unrestricted' checks.

questions.question: A company has a centralized group of users with large file storage requirements that have exceeded the space available on premises. The company wants to extend its file storage capabilities for this group while retaining the performance benefit of sharing content locally. What is the MOST operationally efficient AWS solution for this scenario?
options: Create an Amazon S3 bucket for each user. Mount each bucket by using an S3 file system mounting utility.
Configure and deploy an AWS Storage Gateway file gateway. Connect each user’s workstation to the file gateway.
Move each user’s working environment to Amazon WorkSpaces. Set up an Amazon WorkDocs account for each user.
Deploy an Amazon EC2 instance and attach an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) Provisioned IOPS volume. Share the EBS volume directly with the users.
questions.answer: Configure and deploy an AWS Storage Gateway file gateway. Connect each user’s workstation to the file gateway.
questions.explanation: This solution allows users to access and share files locally while still storing files in the cloud, reducing the need for on-premises storage. The AWS Storage Gateway file gateway provides a high-performance, on-premises file gateway that integrates with Amazon S3.
questions.verified_answer: Configure and deploy an AWS Storage Gateway file gateway. Connect each user’s workstation to the file gateway.

questions.question: Which network security features are supported by Amazon VPC? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon VPC supports Network ACLs, which are stateless firewalls that control inbound and outbound traffic. Security groups are also supported, which are stateful firewalls that control inbound traffic to instances.

questions.question: A company wants to build a new architecture with AWS services. The company needs to compare service costs at various scales. Which AWS service, tool, or feature should the company use to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: The AWS Pricing Calculator allows users to estimate costs for various AWS services at different scales, making it the ideal tool for the company's requirement. It provides a detailed breakdown of costs based on usage and configuration.

questions.question: An Elastic Load Balancer allows the distribution of web traffic across multiple:
questions.explanation: An Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) distributes incoming traffic across multiple Availability Zones to improve responsiveness, reliability, and scalability of applications. This allows ELB to automatically direct traffic to healthy instances in different zones.

questions.question: Which characteristic of the AWS Cloud helps users eliminate underutilized CPU capacity?
questions.explanation: Elasticity in the AWS Cloud allows users to scale their resources up or down based on demand, eliminating underutilized CPU capacity. This means users can quickly increase or decrease their resources to match changing workloads, reducing waste and saving costs.

questions.question: Which AWS services make use of global edge locations? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) that uses global edge locations to cache and distribute content. AWS Global Accelerator is a service that uses global edge locations to improve the performance and availability of applications by routing traffic to the nearest edge location.

questions.question: Which of the following are economic benefits of using AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
options: AWS Enterprise Support at no additional cost
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Consumption-based pricing' because it allows customers to only pay for the resources they use, reducing costs. 'Economies of scale' is also correct because AWS can provide services at a lower cost due to its large scale of operations.

questions.question: A company is using Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling to scale its Amazon EC2 instances. Which benefit of the AWS Cloud does this example illustrate?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling allows the company to scale its Amazon EC2 instances up or down based on demand, which is a key characteristic of elasticity. Elasticity enables the company to quickly adapt to changing workloads and requirements.

questions.question: A company is running and managing its own Docker environment on Amazon EC2 instances. The company wants to alternate to help manage cluster size, scheduling, and environment maintenance. Which AWS service meets these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers that can manage cluster size, scheduling, and environment maintenance, making it suitable for the company's needs. It allows users to run containers without worrying about the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question: A company hosts an application on an Amazon EC2 instance. The EC2 instance needs to access several AWS resources, including Amazon S3 and Amazon DynamoDB. What is the MOST operationally efficient solution to delegate permissions?
options: Create an IAM role with the required permissions. Attach the role to the EC2 instance.
Create an IAM user and use its access key and secret access key in the application.
Create an IAM user and use its access key and secret access key to create a CLI profile in the EC2 instance
Create an IAM role with the required permissions. Attach the role to the administrative IAM user.
answer: Create an IAM role with the required permissions. Attach the role to the EC2 instance.
Create an IAM user and use its access key and secret access key to create a CLI profile in the EC2 instance
questions.explanation: This is the most operationally efficient solution because IAM roles allow EC2 instances to access AWS resources without requiring access keys or secret access keys. It also provides better security and management compared to using IAM users or attaching roles to administrative users.
questions.verified_answer: Create an IAM role with the required permissions. Attach the role to the EC2 instance.

questions.question: Who is responsible for managing IAM user access and secret keys according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: IAM access and secret keys are static, so there is no need to rotate them.
The customer is responsible for rotating keys.
AWS will rotate the keys whenever required.
The AWS Support team will rotate keys when requested by the customer.
questions.answer: The customer is responsible for rotating keys.
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for managing IAM user access and secret keys, including rotating them to maintain security. This is because the customer has control over their AWS account and its resources.
questions.verified_answer: The customer is responsible for rotating keys.

questions.question: A company is running a Microsoft SQL Server instance on premises and is migrating its application to AWS. The company lacks the resources needed to refactor the application, but management wants to reduce operational overhead as part of the migration. Which database service would MOST effectively support these requirements?
options: Microsoft SQL Server on Amazon EC2
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS for SQL Server allows the company to run their existing Microsoft SQL Server instance on AWS, reducing the need for application refactoring. This also provides a managed database service, reducing operational overhead.

questions.question: A company wants to increase its ability to recover its infrastructure in the case of a natural disaster. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this ability represent?
questions.explanation: The ability to recover infrastructure in the case of a natural disaster is a key aspect of reliability, as it ensures that the system can withstand and recover from disruptions. This is a core principle of the Reliability pillar in the AWS Well-Architected Framework.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides the capability to view end-to-end performance metrics and troubleshoot distributed applications?
questions.explanation: AWS X-Ray provides end-to-end performance metrics and allows for the troubleshooting of distributed applications. It helps developers identify performance bottlenecks and optimize their applications.

questions.question: Which tasks require use of the AWS account root user? (Choose two.)
options: Modifying an Amazon EC2 instance type
Grouping resources in AWS Systems Manager
Running applications in Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)
questions.explanation: The AWS account root user is required for tasks that involve account-level changes, such as modifying the AWS Support plan or closing the account. Modifying an Amazon EC2 instance type, grouping resources in AWS Systems Manager, and running applications in Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) can be performed using IAM users or roles with the necessary permissions.
questions.verified_answer: Changing an AWS Support plan, Closing an AWS account

questions.question: Which of the following describes AWS Local Zones?
options: A cluster of data centers in one geographic location
A site used by Amazon CloudFront to cache frequently accessed content
An extension of an AWS Region to more granular locations
One or more data centers with redundant power and networking
questions.answer: An extension of an AWS Region to more granular locations
questions.explanation: AWS Local Zones are smaller, isolated locations that extend an existing AWS Region to more granular locations, providing lower latency and faster access to AWS services. They are not a separate Region, but rather an extension of an existing one.
questions.verified_answer: An extension of an AWS Region to more granular locations

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature is highly available by default?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS is highly available by default due to its multi-AZ deployment feature, which automatically replicates data across multiple Availability Zones. This ensures that the database remains accessible even in the event of a zone failure.

questions.question: A company wants to improve its security and audit posture by limiting Amazon EC2 inbound access. What should the company use to access instances remotely instead of opening inbound SSH ports and managing SSH keys?
questions.explanation: AWS Systems Manager Session Manager allows users to access instances remotely without opening inbound SSH ports, providing a secure and managed way to connect to instances. This is a more secure alternative to managing SSH keys and opening inbound SSH ports.

questions.question: A user needs the ability to access as many resources as are needed. The user also needs the ability to scale up and scale down with only a few minutes of notice. Which benefit of the AWS Cloud describes these abilities?
questions.explanation: Elasticity in the AWS Cloud refers to the ability to scale up or down to meet changing business needs, providing the flexibility to quickly adapt to changing demands. This allows users to access as many resources as needed with minimal notice.

questions.question: Which task is an AWS responsibility when a workload is running in Amazon RDS?
questions.explanation: When running a workload in Amazon RDS, AWS is responsible for installing and maintaining the database engine, such as MySQL or PostgreSQL. This includes patching and upgrading the engine to ensure security and performance.

questions.question: A company is building a mobile app to provide shopping recommendations to its customers. The company wants to use a graph database as part of the shopping recommendation engine. Which AWS database service should the company choose?
questions.explanation: Amazon Neptune is a graph database service that supports popular graph models such as Property Graph, Graph Binary JSON (GBJ), and TinkerPop Gremlin. It is the most suitable choice for the company's shopping recommendation engine, which requires complex relationships between data entities.

questions.question: Which duty is a responsibility of AWS under the AWS shared responsibility model?
questions.explanation: In the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for maintaining physical hardware, including the security of the data centers and servers. This is because AWS has control over the physical infrastructure and is responsible for ensuring its security and integrity.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows users to provision resources using a consistent and repeatable process?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation allows users to provision resources using a consistent and repeatable process by defining infrastructure as code. This enables users to manage and track changes to their infrastructure in a predictable and reproducible manner.

questions.question: A company has an application workload that is stateless be design and can sustain occasional downtime. The application performs massively parallel computations. Which Amazon EC2 pricing model should the company choose for its application to reduce cost?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are suitable for applications that can sustain occasional downtime and perform massively parallel computations, as they allow for cost-effective use of unused EC2 capacity. This pricing model is ideal for workloads that can be interrupted and restarted without significant impact on the application's functionality.

questions.question: A company wants to establish a private network connection between AWS and its corporate network. Which AWS service or feature will meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect is a network service that makes it possible to establish a dedicated network connection from an on-premises network to AWS. This allows for a private and secure connection between the corporate network and AWS.

questions.question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for applying the latest security updates and patches for which of the following?
questions.explanation: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for the security of the operating system, applications, and any associated data on Amazon EC2 instances. This includes applying the latest security updates and patches.

questions.question: Which AWS service is a relational database compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL?
questions.explanation: Amazon Aurora is a relational database service that supports MySQL and PostgreSQL, allowing for seamless migration of existing databases. It provides high performance, durability, and scalability for relational databases.

questions.question: Which AWS service should a company use to continuously monitor the compliance of AWS resource configurations?
questions.explanation: AWS Config is a service that continuously monitors and records AWS resource configurations and changes, enabling companies to track compliance with their desired configurations and identify any deviations. It provides a detailed history of resource configurations, allowing for auditing and compliance checks.
